campaign.story:
IN ENGLISH (link en ESPAÑOL)
We are giving away ALL the Stretch Goals!
The Southern Lady cuts through the waves, the water spraying your face as you stare out at the Caribbean sea. Lost in thought, you remember the first time you came across a Spanish Galleon. Few of you managed to escape that mess with your lives, but that marked the moment when you began forging your destiny as a pirate. Now, your reputation precedes you wherever you go, instilling fear among your enemies. Nothing will get in your way of becoming the most infamous pirate to ever sail the high seas…
Make your own destiny and become the terror of the seas in Skull Tales: Full Sail!
Skull Tales: Full Sail! is a pirate adventures board game with miniatures. Set sail on the Southern Lady and explore the beautiful Caribbean sea, ripe with fearsome enemies and amazing treasures. Fame and fortune await you!
Choose among twelve starting characters, each one with its own unique miniature, to be used on the different boards as you play through the game. Find all the information you need to start playing on their character sheets.
In Skull Tales: Full Sail! You’ll be able to play individual scenarios or embark upon an immersive campaign that threads several different scenarios together into one captivating storyline.
Skull Tales, created by David Illescas, is a semi-cooperative game for 1-5 players aged 14 and up. The approximate playing time in Campaign Mode is between 60-90 minutes for one scenario and about 150 minutes for a complete chapter (Voyage, Adventure and Port). The game also includes 52 miniatures - not counting stretch goals!
During the Voyage Phase, which simulates being on a pirate ship, we’ll be managing the crew that makes up our ship while we explore the map on the way towards our objective...or objectives! But, the Captain might have a hidden agenda that he/she is keeping from the rest of the crew…
Throughout this phase, characters will take on different jobs: steering the ship, managing boarding actions, cleaning up, or even fighting sea creatures. The idea is to gain the confidence of the crew, which will depend on where you place your character and how good he/she is at dealing with all the dangerous events you’ll be facing together. The Captain will be able to assign different tasks to the crewmembers, but watch out - the other pirates can conspire against him/her!
Unfortunately, but not surprisingly, there are a lot of things that can negatively affect crew's morale: hunger, losing battles, unexpected events, etc. If morale suffers too much, another pirate can organize a mutiny to take over the captaincy and benefit from its many privileges…
Characters will earn Trust Points as they carry out duties on the ship, and these points will turn into Prestige Points once the Voyage phase comes to an end. This way, your pirate will start to gain a fearsome reputation!
In the Adventure Phase you’ll explore mysterious islands, dangerous caves, and abandoned temples. You’ll also have the chance to pillage colonial villas and find legendary objects. However, there are frightening creatures and challenging enemies to face along the way.
The Adventure map develops as terrain tiles appear randomly according to the specifications of the scenario, making each game different!
On the Adventure board you’ll be able to see how much time you have left to carry out the mission, as well as the current danger level…
Enemies have cards that outline their characteristics and a corresponding miniature. Also, every opponent you face will have a behavior or AI that generates reactions at unpredictable times, making each adventure a challenge.
In the Port Phase your character can acquire new abilities and equipment by interacting with the residents of Tortuga Island and visiting its different locations. But be careful, this place hides secrets that can make a pirate’s fate take a turn for the worst.
Each player will have time units they’ll use to carry out actions, while making sure they are ready to go when the ship sets sail: heal wounds, learn abilities, make bets, listen out for rumors, equip and improve the ship, etc. Each location has an Event Deck, and there are also independent decks for Rumors and Captain Assignments.
The following list has everything initially included in the base game, not counting components that may have been unlocked during the Kickstarter campaign.
The base game box also comes with a quick-start 10 chapter campaign (Campaign I) and a couple of special scenarios.
The new Skull Tales miniatures have been completely remodeled and will be made with a high quality plastic that is flexible, easy to paint, and allows for more clearly detailed figures. We have already started testing and the results are spectacular.
The scale of the miniatures is approximately 30-32mm up to the eye-line and not including the base.
 (Images courtesy from Icue)
PIRATE contest! (Unlocked): Share videos, photos or audio files of your family and friends with a pirate theme. If we get 200 interactions, between Twitter & Facebook, we will include a sliding chest box to store our booty (80x80x50mm) for all the backers of the game. Additionally, we will include a new Journey card dedicated to the crew of the best submission, as well as a gift for the winning crew.
For more information.
For more information: See all our booty: the first 46 Stretch Goals.
$431000 (Unlocked, Free Expansion): New Enemy: Amazons (6 miniatures). They were strong, muscular women with a height that surpassed our tallest men. They seemed taken by some strange trance, as their rage was supernatural… The true Amazonians arrive, whose legend gave name to one of the most famous rivers in the world. These warrior princesses are willing to fight to the last woman, and woe the man who stands in their way! 6 Amazonian miniatures with enemy card.
$438000 (Unlocked, Free Expansion): New cards for the incident deck, adding 4 new dangers to our adventures.
$445000 (Unlocked, Free Expansion): We are changing four small tile designs into two large tile designs to give scenarios more variety. This double-sided tile is like the Village tiles in that it is 4 times bigger than the smaller ones.
$460000 (Unlocked, Free Expansion): New Enemy: Stranglers (4 miniatures). We came ashore in the midst of a frightful fog – you could barely see your hand in front of your face. The vast mounds of seaweed were beyond anything natural, suggesting that the tide in this area was stronger and pulled any marine life from the depths of the sea onto the beaches. When the seaweed began to move, I felt as though someone was strangling me to death. Fear overcame me, especially when I saw our pistols did little damage against the shapes covered in seaweed. Another enemy comes to join the rest of the abominations. On this occasion, we’re releasing 4 Strangler miniatures and their enemy card.
$467000 (Unlocked, Free Expansion): 4 Equipment Cards (2 models). You won’t believe the beauty that I found on the last galley captured by the Brotherhood… Our market keeps on receiving new merchandise to equip your pirates with the best against their enemies. 2 x Light Blunderbuss: able to fire at adjacent enemies, but with a shorter range than pistols. 2 x Poison Vials: choose a melee weapon at the beginning of the adventure. That weapon inflicts an additional wound.
$487000 (Unlocked, Free Expansion): Tarantula Anansi (Giant miniature). And Anansi came from the shadows, wrapping that pirate up in a cocoon of silk, making quick work of the poor lad… The powerful tarantula Anansi has arrived to Skull Tales: Full Sail! the Caribbean will never be safe with the presence of this supernatural beast. This time, we’re adding an enemy that brings new game mechanics with enemies that take up four spaces. The Tarantula Anansi is represented by a miniature the size of 4 spaces, and comes with her corresponding enemy card.
$494000 (Unlocked, Base Game): 5 Port Events. The chapel was quieter than usual, the silence falling over the silhouettes as they brought their offerings. This didn’t feel right… Five new events to add variety to the Port Phase.
$509000 (Unlocked, Free Expansion): Campaign V complete. The Brotherhood has received what at first was thought to be a Royal order. After the initial refusal to carry it out, it has become an ultimatum. They have been accused of being behind a series of supernatural events that is reducing the free labor population in the colonies and negatively affecting profits from the slave trade. Either the Brotherhood takes charge of solving this mystery, or the British Empire will bring down all its might upon Tortuga Isle. The only clue that we have involves the appearance, however strange, of huge amounts of spider webs after each event…
$516000 (Unlocked, Free Expansion): 4 Equipment Cards. You have asked us on many occasions and our armorer has listened…we’re adding one more copy of the Net, Hook, Bandoleer, and Shovel cards.
$530000 (Unlocked, Free Expansion): Character: Swordsman.  "He spent years searching for his mother’s assassin. But, although he is a master fencer, his sanity is fading away, and he now spends most of his day accusing anyone who crosses his path: “You killed my mother... prepare to die!"
We’re going to add 6 Final Boss designs to the enemy cards. Each boss will have its own personalized characteristics with different behaviors and abilities. Tlanchana, the queen of the mermaids; Oggum, herald of Yemayá; Charles Vane, Captain of the Black Sails; and Anansi, the avatar tarantula. We kept rummaging through our last treasure chest and we’ve found a pack of more than 5 cards that are being added to the ones already unlocked. What surprises are to be found on these cards?
Go to your pledge, use the "manage my pledge" button and manually add the amount of US$ for everything you would like to add. When the campaign is over, we will do a Pledge Manager that lets you confirm all of the details of your pledge.
40 Metal Pirate Coins: We have listened to the requests of many of you, and we can finally announce our new ADD-ON with 40 aged metal coins of 25mm in diameter and a thickness of about 1.5-1.8mm. With our own spectacular design, this great set of coins will bring: 20 coins in copper color, 10 in silver and 10 in gold.
Set of 12 Doors & 5 Chests: This $18 ADD-ON is for those of you want to upgrade those tokens and replace them with miniatures, or even to use them in other games. The chests are placed over the target tokens, and the doors are to be used in spaces of buildings and rooms in the Village. This set will come in a 17x13x3cm cardboard box.
Set of 10 custom Dice: we bring you a new add-on with a spectacular design, to make your games of Skull Tales: Full Sail! even more thematic. Ten dice with a very exclusive design, with custom faces, and in two different colors, bone white and ash gray. Are you ready to test your luck for just $14?
Wooden Dice tower in sight! We are proud to announce that we have a final design! It’s very easy to set up and it can be dismounted just as easily, without the need for glue. This add-on will come with its own cardboard box. You can take a look at how it works in the following video…More information.
The Twins: two miniatures representing the Twins Characters, controlled by one player, with two Character cards and exclusive equipment.
Sea Miniatures for Voyage Phase: 11 miniatures to replace the tokens in the Voyage Phase.
For backers of the previous publisher, we’ve included a new customized ADD-ON with the 3 new Sea Miniatures and the Sea Monster for $9.
Witch and Freedman miniatures for those of you that couldn’t get these figures in the game three years ago.
Box with the 52 miniatures included in the game.

updates.update_content:
Greetings, pirates! (link en español)
The Brotherhood of the Coast reports that the ship on which the Tortuga expansion travels is sailing at a good pace.
After a longer than desired Port Phase, due to several Port Event cards regarding the widespread difficulties that maritime shipping is experiencing, it has finally embarked and is sailing on the container ship One Millau on its way to Barcelona and our warehouse.

«The cabin boy leaned over the gunwale,after looking around nervously and checking that no one would blame him for leaving the deck unwashed, gawking at the view of the port. He had never seen so many pirate ships at anchor, nor so much activity in the docks, Tortuga Island was more alive than ever!»

Ahoy, Pirates! (link en español)
We have very good news for you: Skull Tales: Full Sail! has a small expansion. It has been developed and tested since last year by the author (David Illescas) and his regular game collaborators.
Tortuga expansion

Hi Pirates, (link en español)
“Those ships...how to describe them? I had never seen anything like them after a lifetime of fishing in the islands. They looked like shells of giant Kappas covered with metal and wood. And black fumes came out of their steel mouths decorated with pagan symbols from the Great Continent! Now everyone has abandoned the village and only my sons and I remain, praying for the help of the Kaizoku. But they haven’t answered our call...not a single day, not once...since those giants of fire arrived from the other side of the ocean.

Pirates, ahoy! (link en español)

campaign.story:
Being an artist can sometimes feel like playing hopscotch in a minefield. 

Imagine posting artwork online that you're proud of only to be met with accusations of racial stereotyping, fat-phobia, colorism, transphobia and just all around insensitivity.
Artists can often feel sucker punched by audiences at large and suddenly find themselves trending on social media for all the wrong reasons. 
Granted, you can never control how the world reacts to your art, but what if there was a book that could elucidate the problems before you start and help you understand where people are coming from? 
That's what "How to draw black people" is all about. 

The first in a planned series of books that focus on the culture of people of color, rather than just the aesthetics. 
The unwritten idea, but tangible logic, that "if you can draw a white person you can draw anyone" just won't cut it anymore. 

Audiences are asking for diversity and authentic characters based on real cultures. The teachings we have now are woefully out of date and never touch on ways to depict more that what lies on the surface. 
Not Just another "How to" Book.
Tutorial on hair
How to Draw Black People isn't a book where artists are provided with facial grids and examples of modelesque people, with some cool poses to try and emulate. 

While there will be step by step guides artists are accustomed to, this book will include entire sections devoted to: 
Anatomy
Facial anatomy  
Facial expressions
Hair
Skin tone
Costuming 
Culture and customs 
And within these sections we delve deeper into things like colorism, fatphobia, gender expression, and how all these things play into visualizing black characters. Everything cited and sourced, all the research done so artists can trust the info or hopefully use it as a starting point learn more.   
Crowdfunded and Crowd Sourced. 
While I will supply the bulk of tutorials and tips provided in the book multiple talented artists will also give their take on how to approach each topic; how to apply what's being highlighted in different styles, and give their own take on what they believe is important when it comes to creating diverse characters. 

Also in the book will be a wealth of photo reference for artists to take advantage. A compilation of everyday black folks across the African diaspora. Special attention will be paid to the differences between drawing someone from the west indies, Ethiopia, Brazil or South Africa. 
Learn how to depict culture instead of stereotypes 
 Artists often feel like they don't know what will draw the ire of a socially conscious community, and they are right; they don't know. Artists are taught by and large to copy but rarely to intuit. Art courses require us to recreate and translate without necessarily understanding the subject. 

That lack of understanding is the cause for a lot of anxiety and unintended strife between audiences and artists. 

The hope is that by focusing on culture, comparing and contrasting the differences between the acceptable and the offensive, artists can better themselves. This book will help artists of all levels create more meaningful, authentic diversity and representation. 

Back "How to Draw Black People" today and make this crucial resource for artists a reality.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Challenges for this book are mild at best. The biggest being filling out the roster of artists who will give alternate opinions on subject matter. Another challenge will be finding models and getting the correct photo reference for the purpose of this book, a process I've already begun. The scope of this project will require that outsource the shipping responsibilities to a certain degree and thus any delays in shipping rewards will be incumbent on a third party. 

However the majority of content will come from myself, the research will be done primarily by me thus making the risks minimal and majorly within my control.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

 SHIPPING AND DELIVERY
Our estimated Shipping Date is mid-February 2019. Of course, we hope to get your dice to you much sooner than that, but if we’ve learned anything from producing dice, it’s that there can be delays! However, we’ve taken every precaution to mitigate those factors.
LATE BACKERS & PLEDGE CHANGES

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We have a great relationship with the factory that makes our iconic dice sets. Over the past year, we have produced some of the most sought-after dice sets on the market, from the original Cotton Candy, to Iconic Blue, to our latest release, Ethereal Shaman, that recently sold out in 3 just minutes. 

However, there could be some variables in terms of timing when it comes to anything produced in China, such as: Production delays, Shipping delays, and Customs delays. To take these factors into account, we’ve over-estimated when we plan on shipping your rewards to you. 

This is our first Kickstarter, but creating amazing RPG dice sets is nothing new to us. Every Kraken Dice die is individually hand checked twice, once during production and one last time before being shipped. This ensures that you only get the best quality dice. This process, though, can also potentially cause delays, but in the end, you get a superior product for your tabletop.

 All of our dice have a 30-day guarantee. If for some reason you are not happy with them, you can send them back for a full refund.

campaign.story:
Welcome to Brook City, officers!
Brook City is a cooperative board game for 1-4 players, designed by Adam and Brady Sadler. The game features highly detailed miniatures and the Modular Deck System (MDS) introduced in Street Masters. In the game, players take on the role of heroic cops inspired by classic action movies and are tasked with protecting the city from the recent rise in criminal activity. Each game is dictated by the chosen criminal deck and case deck. These decks are modular and the different combinations of decks create unique experiences each game.
The game is played on a beautifully illustrated board of the city, where the cops must run or drive to various locations and bust up crimes. While cops start the game with a standard issue B.C.P.D. Cruiser, they can also commandeer many other types of vehicles on the streets of Brook City.
Each cop in Brook City plays differently thanks to each having their own unique cop deck. Cop decks include encounter cards, ability cards, and tactic cards to represent each cop’s unique strengths and strategy to take on the criminals underworld.
While the cops try to crack the case, their prime suspect is represented by the criminal deck. Each criminal deck contains at least 1 suspect card, as well as a slew of crime cards that spawn crew members around the city to interfere with your detective work. If cops ignore these criminal masterminds while trying to pin the crime on them, things may just get seriously out of hand…
Case decks represent the cops’ overall goal of the game. While keeping the criminal under control, they must also concentrate on working their way through the case. Each case has special rules governing how cops can interact with clue cards and get their hands on enough evidence to bring the criminal to justice. In addition to clue cards, case decks include a variety of events that are designed to hinder the cops or punish them for not making enough progress solving the case.
You don’t have to take our word on how the game plays. Please click HERE to read a draft of the rulebook.
Brook City features a variety of highly detailed miniatures, which are used to mark the location of the cops, criminals, and crew throughout the city. With our experience producing miniatures in our previous game, Street Masters, we are confident in the level of detail and overall quality of the miniatures that will be in this game. While we were extremely happy with the miniatures in Street Masters, we learned some tricks to improve them even more for Brook City.
         Blacklist Games is committed to publishing only high quality games. Please watch this video of Adam and Brady unboxing a production copy of Street Masters:
As you can see from the video, great care was taken to ensure every component was of the best quality possible. Backers of this campaign can feel confident that the same amount of care and attention to detail will be taken with Brook City as well.
Like many other publishers, we will be charging shipping after the Kickstarter concludes based on the actual costs incurred to ship. We will collect this via our pledge manager after the campaign ends. This is so we can be fair to to you all since final shipping sizes are unpredictable with a growing campaign. Plus this gives more room to pool into stretch goals and as much cool gameplay stuff as we possibly can.
After manufacturing, we'll ship your rewards at our cost to our international hubs. Following, is a rough estimate for shipping a standard game package (approx. 4kg volumetric weight). Keep in mind these are just estimates, and costs may rise based on weight increases from unlocked stretch goals and any add-ons you choose.
USA: $10-$15 to most states. ($30 to Alaska, Hawaii, and Puerto Rico.)
CANADA: $10-$20 to most cities.
LATIN AMERICA: $50-$60 to most countries.
ASIA: $15-20 to China and Hong Kong. $30 to most other countries (we can't predict an estimate cost to Malaysia, Singapore, or Indonesia).
OCEANIA: $15-$25 to Australia. $30 to New Zealand. AFRICA: $80 to most countries.
EUROPE: $15-$30 to most countries. $35 to Norway, Finland, Estland, Lettland, and Latvia. $40 to Bosnia/Herzegovina, Croatia, and Serbia. $55 to Bulgaria, Lithuania, and Romania. $60 to Iceland and Israel. $45 to Greece and Turkey.
Unfortunately, different import laws and customs from some specific countries have made it impossible for our shipping/fulfillment partner to ship to such as Russia, Ukraine, Kazakhstan and Afghanistan. Due to that we will not ship to these areas.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Following our successful campaign for Street Masters: Rise of the Kingdom, we've taken what we've learned from production, shipping and fulfillment to strive for an even smoother experience from start to finish, continuing to focus on overall quality.

There are a lot of moving parts from the Kickstarter, production, manufacture, to fulfillment, then distribution. Timing seems to be one of the biggest obstacles in many campaigns, especially from small, indie publishers such as ourselves. Fortunately, we've got experienced game designers working hard to ensure the gameplay offers the best experience it can be; we have strong relations with the factory/manufacture; we have a shipment/fulfillment company already signed on; we are completely passionate about our games; and most important, we care about our backers.

We also understand there may still be confusion about our first campaign, as it was a card game that we cancelled. It didn't receive the momentum it needed due to us purchasing the rights from a publisher that has not had much luck in the industry. Currently we're developing an app for the game and tightening up some of the original rules and cards in order to release it under our brand at a future date. Doing this will give us the time we need to ensure that the game will make a great edition to our library as well as yours.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

I'm currently spending some time in lockup thanks to those no-good Murdock twins, so thought I'd pass the time by pestering you goody two-shoes from inside the slammer. How, you ask? updates.update_userinfo: Briefing 37: The Stakeout Before the Bust
updates.update_content:
Welcome Officers! As we finish another couple of weeks of fulfillment, here are some updates as of last Friday. 
VFI Asia said that they are trying to get things going for us but their backlog has had issues that keep pushing us out. They said that ours is still their priority (before any new projects), but they have to knock out what they were working on before they can push forward for us. But at the very least, they gave us a hard date that they will finish shipping sooner than May 10th. I sent them an email to ask them if that meant backers receiving packages in Asia or labels being created and they assured me that it means the packages will have left their facilities before then.

In 2085 A.D., armored warfare is faster and deadlier than ever. Hovercraft speed over the battlefield. Tanks use tactical nukes. Infantry is equipped with battlesuits of incredible firepower. But they all fear one foe . . .
The Ogre.
You’ve seen the great plastic minis for Ogre. Now Steve Jackson’s award-winning Ogre Miniatures rulebook is back, with brand new photography throughout and stats for all the new units.
Ogre Miniatures Second Edition is a 64-page book that comes with a separate reference sheet, full-color die-cut templates and craters, and 24 Ogre (and Superheavy) 2-sided record cards. This is a complete rules set; you will need a die, some miniatures, and a table to play on. 
We do not plan to offer this book through regular distribution channels. Retailers can buy it through Kickstarter. Unless your retailer uses Kickstarter (tell them they should!) the only way to get this book is to support the campaign, or buy direct from SJ Games if we still have leftovers. 
The book is already written, photographed, and laid out. We can send out the PDFs shortly after the campaign ends. That’ll be in June 2018. Printing will take a little longer . . . the printed copy will be delivered in November 2018. 
PDF Only – $10. No physical rewards. A copy of Ogre Miniatures Second Edition in PDF format. Delivery June 2018. 
One Printed Copy – $35. Ogre Miniatures Second Edition. You also get the book, the support material, and the one-sheet reference Ogre Miniatures Lite, in PDF format. All PDF files available June 2018, all physical components ship November 2018.
Retailers – $50. Three copies of the book. This support level is available only to legitimate brick & mortar retailers, and yes, we check. Delivery November 2018.
Two Printed Copies – $65. A pair of Ogre Miniatures Second Edition books. Give one as a gift, or loan it to your opponent when you play. You also get the book, the support material, and the one-sheet reference Ogre Miniatures Lite, in PDF format. All PDF files available June 2018, all physical components ship November 2018.
Printed Book + Battle Box – $110. Gives you everything you need except a table. One copy of Ogre Miniatures Second Edition, plus the complete PDF set, plus the Battle Box. All PDF files available June 2018, all physical components ship November 2018.
The Battle Box includes:
Ogre Miniatures Set 1 & 2 in gray plastic
5 double-sided Ogre Record Cards
32-page Updated Ogre Designer’s Edition Rulebook
G1 Map – (paper) 28.5” x 33”
Six-sided Die
11 x 17 Reference and Scenario Sheet
8" x 10" Counter Sheet 
I Want It All! Printed Book + Many Minis – $150. The complete "The Printed Book + Battle Box" level PLUS four more Set 2 armies and extra Fencer and Ogre Mark IV in black. All PDF files available June 2018, all physical components ship November 2018.
The year is 2085. Advanced technology has led to enhanced weapons that are faster and deadlier than ever, but even the most seasoned soldier fears one enemy: The Ogre!
With the Printed Book + Battle Box, you’ll have everything you need to play as the devious Ogre or as the raggedy band of survivors attempting to defeat it! Set up your miniatures on a table and use either ruleset to play a hexmap wargame or a hexless minis game. You don’t have to work to gather everything you need to play the game of futuristic warfare – it’s all here for you!

updates.update_content:
Thanks to your support, we've produced two sets of plastic Ogre miniatures, making it easy for players to collect dozens – hundreds! – of miniatures at a reasonable price.
Now, with your help, we will take two of the harder-to-find metal miniatures and upgrade them to plastic, making it easier for everyone to add these cybertanks to their Ogre Miniatures collections. More info posted at the official Steve Jackson Games forums.
As always, please keep a close eye on the official Ogre forums, as well as our Facebook and accounts, for the latest news about and all Steve Jackson Games projects.

During the waning days of this campaign, you unlocked the $85,000 combined sales stretch goal, that being a future Kickstarter for the Ogre Mark VI and Doppelsoldner. Since then, arguably the top question I've been asked regarding Ogre Miniatures is "When will you run the Kickstarter for those Ogres?" Well, we now have an answer . . . sort of! We are looking at a Kickstarter to begin in mid-June (the exact start date is still a little in flux) and will run to July 3.
Titled Ogre Miniatures Set 3, it will feature the two biggest and baddest Ogres ever to prowl the land. We have been working with our partners to transition the metal miniatures into plastic, all the while ensuring the highest quality result. I think you will be pleased.

updates.update_userinfo: Ogre Playmat M1 Errata + A Look at Playmats M1, M3, M4, and M5 Combined
updates.update_content:
While working on new playmats for the Ogre Battlefields project (which has unlocked lots of stretch goals; check it out!), we uncovered an error with Ogre Playmat M1 that will be corrected in future printings. 
In yesterday's Ogre Battlefields update we wrote:
"When we were reviewing the playmats, we noticed an error on the southern edge of the M1 playmat that, unfortunately, is a part of all of the previously-printed M1 playmats. Two hexes on the southern side of the map do not properly align with the northern edge of the design. We are correcting this in theplaymats that will be printed as a part of this Kickstarter project. We're sorry for the mistake, and we will take steps to improve our checking process for future playmats."

updates.update_userinfo: U.S. Shipping Complete, Ogre Battlefields on Kickstarter, and a Warehouse Find!
updates.update_content:
The fulfillment warehouse has been packing and shipping books and rewards as quickly as possible, and now we can report that the U.S. packages are in transit and should reach all of you over the next week or two. If you have already received your package, please let us know! Post to Facebook or Twitter and be sure to tag us so that we can see your pics and comments!
Ogre Battlefields

The fulfillment warehouse has been slammed with the holiday rush, but we can now report that the first copies of the Ogre Miniatures, Second Edition are starting to leave the fulfillment warehouse. First up, shipping out the Kickstarter rewards. After that, they'll switch to mailing out the Warehouse 23 preorders (only preorders for the book; if your preorder included anything else, those will be handled by Warehouse 23 in mid-December).

The Ogre Miniatures rulebook landed at our fulfillment warehouse yesterday, and the books will start mailing out to you within the next week. The warehouse is preparing the shipments; we'll post an update when the last package is on the truck and on the way to your door. Thanks for your patience as the warehouse crew pack and ship as fast as they can manage.
Ogre Battlefields Coming to Kickstarter

Good news! The Ogre Miniatures, Second Edition rulebook is scheduled to reach our U.S. fulfillment partner around November 15! Once the books reach the warehouse, we'll process the rewards just as fast as possible and try to get all of them shipped before the end of November. 
At the moment, Steve and Drew are reviewing the Battlefields material, and we're discussing possible launch dates for that Kickstarter project. We've not yet 100% decided on an exact time, but a December timeframe is looking possible. Please be sure you're following Steve Jackson Games on Kickstarter so that you don't miss out on when the project opens up.

It's the final hours of the Ogrezine 2 project, and it's important that we let you know that since the project launched, supporters have unlocked the new Ogre Playmat M3 as an add-on. That makes a total of three different 24-inch square cloth, neoprene-backed battlefields available as part of this latest Ogre campaign.
Additionally, the $26k stretch goal has been unlocked, and all Ogrezine 2 supporters backing at the $28 reward level or higher will be receiving one black plastic Ogre (randomly selected) as part of their rewards.

campaign.story:
Inspired by the legendary tales of horror, myth and folklore by Mike Mignola, Hellboy: The Board Game is a fully cooperative experience for 1 to 4 players. You become a member of the Bureau for Paranormal Research and Defence (BPRD), ready to investigate occult threats that threaten our very existence. You will explore gothic locations, hunt down clues, discover artefacts, fight horrific creatures and face off against terrifying bosses.
For more details about the 'Box Full of Evil' click here.
For full details of what's included in the Darkness Calls expansion, click here.
 For full details of what's included in the Hellboy in Mexico expansion, click here.
RESIN MINIATURES
For more details on the resin miniatures, please check here.
Designed by James M. Hewitt - the brains behind the likes of Blood Bowl 2016, Necromunda: Underhive, and Warhammer Quest: Silver Tower - Hellboy: The Board Game features incredibly detailed, pre-assembled PVC plastic miniatures that capture the unique look and feel of Mike Mignola’s visionary work.    
Miniatures supplied unpainted.
Hellboy: The Board Game gives you the chance to take control of an iconic member of the BPRD. Choose from Hellboy, Abe Sapien, Liz Sherman and Johann Kraus before equipping your agent with additional items that will help in the mission ahead. Each trinket, charm or weapon costs money though, so you’ll need to spend wisely.    
Artwork and text subject to approval.
Each of the missions in the core game begins by reading a BPRD Case File. This will set the scene for the investigation ahead and give hints about what threats you may encounter. The contents of each Case File are top secret, so the first time you play you'll have no idea what you're about to face!   
Miniatures supplied unpainted.
During play, agents must carefully balance the Information Gathered track against the ominous Impending Doom track. Information Gathered represents the clues you uncover about the monster you’re hunting, while the Impending Doom track marks how close humanity is to the brink of destruction.   
Artwork and text subject to approval.
Do you spend valuable time investigating the scene to find a vital piece of the puzzle that could expose a crucial weakness of your foe, but risk the Impending Doom track reaching its devastating finale? Or do you forget the clues and rush through to a final confrontation before the monster has gathered its strength? No one said being a BPRD Agent would be easy.   
Miniatures supplied unpainted.
Ahead of the climatic battle, you’ll have to face all manner of creatures that lurk in the shadows, ready to pounce at a moment’s notice. When the chips are down, it’s time to fight back using an intuitive system of custom coloured dice. Each BPRD agent has a range of special abilities they can use to defeat their enemies, or they can team up when things get really tough.   
Artwork and text subject to approval.
What’s more, no two missions will ever play the same thanks to the terrifying Deck of Doom. Each turn players unveil a Deck of Doom card, which could trigger a new onslaught from the arcane horrors hiding in the location, initiate a special event or simply move the Impending Doom track closer to its dramatic end.     
Artwork and text subject to approval.
No matter what your decisions are during the course of the mission, each play through will always end in an epic final confrontation with one of Hellboy's most notorious adversaries. The board itself changes to reveal the boss' lair and then all gloves are off for a desperate struggle against the forces of evil.  
Kickstarter exclusive box artwork drawn by Mike Mignola!
We currently estimate Hellboy: The Board Game (core game) will contain the following components*:
10 double sided room tiles (2.5mm thick, a mix of 2x2 and 1x2 with a linen finish)
4 Agent Cards
50+ cardboard tokens (damage counters, HQ board markers, target priority counters, furniture, doors, flame markers, etc., 2.5mm thick, with a linen finish)
13 custom dice
Three narrative Case File scenarios (tarot card sized, 310GSM, lined finish, each scenario includes between 6-8 cards)
Card HQ Board (linen finish)
74 Mini Cards (310 GSM, linen finish, Encounter Cards, Back-Up Agent details, Equipment and Starting Items)
48 Standard Cards (310GSM, linen finish, Deck of Doom Cards and Enemy Cards)
18 plastic cubes (Agent action tokens and generic black tokens)
Coloured bases to fit on Agents
Rulebook
*these are given as a guidance because the game is currently in development. We will keep backers updated with any changes to components
BPRD ARCHIVES EXPANSION
Also included in your pledge is the BPRD Archives expansion. This is an opportunity for you to create your own BPRD Mission Case File. You start by choosing the location – will it be an abandoned mansion, spooky graveyard, or something more sinister? Then select the foe you want to face in the final confrontation or just leave it to chance, so it's a mystery until the dramatic climax!
Work in progress Case File cards. Artwork/text subject to approval.
Once you’ve created the Case File, it’s time to make the accompanying Deck of Doom. You’ve got complete control to make the game as easy, or as challenging as you want by selecting the Deck of Doom cards and then shuffling them together. These will then be drawn as you're playing through the mission.   
Artwork and text subject to approval.
Finally choose your Encounter Cards. These will dictate what's inside each room and what monsters you will face. Combine these with your  Enemy Cards to battle against wild creatures, hideous Frog Monsters or Nazi soldiers. The choice is yours!  
Future releases and expansions will feature elements that can be combined with the BPRD Archives, so the experience will keep growing and the gameplay will keep changing long after you've finished your first adventure.
   MINIATURES
We've worked extremely hard to capture the style of the Hellboy comics. Each miniature has been approved by Mike Mignola himself and we've taken his feedback on board to make them as stunning as possible.
PLAY

Each miniature will be made from high quality grey PVC plastic and will be pre-assembled, so they're ready to go straight from the box. As you can see in the image below some of the miniatures are huge and will look amazing during play.  
 The videos below use the prototype components we have been using for playtests. The designs/components used are definitely not final but will give you an idea of how the gameplay works.  

Shipping is NOT included in your pledge and will be calculated/charged once the campaign has completed. We recommend waiting until the pledge manager to add the exact amount required. See below regarding import duties and taxes.   
We currently estimate that the shipping costs for the pledges will be approximately:
UK: £9
USA: £12

Rest of World: £25
All add-ons outside the core pledges will have their shipping calculated and charged in the Pledge Manager after the campaign has finished.
Please note, we are unable to ship to these countries: Russia, Ukraine, Kazakhstan and Afghanistan.
We are dedicated to our retail partners worldwide therefore we are delighted to offer you a retail pledge for our new Kickstarter.    
Information about the Hellboy retailer pledge can be found here.
Hellboy™ © Mike Mignola. All rights reserved.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
There are a number of risks with any Kickstarter project, especially getting accurate timings for such complex products with so many components. 

With this project, the rules are currently in testing and will require more playtesting, however we have a dedicated team of playtesters to help with this. Many of the miniatures are already designed and approved by Mike Mignola but some are still in concept stage. Once we have all the miniatures designed, the next part of the process is the tooling and production. We predict that we will begin shipping in February 2019 - however, the exact timing is impossible to predict and there is always the potential for delay with products produced in China. We will of course keep our backers up to date as best we can once the project closes.

To date, we’ve successfully fulfilled 11 Kickstarter campaigns: Kings of War, DreadBall, LOKA, Mars Attacks: The Miniatures Game, Deadzone, DreadBall Xtreme, Dungeon Saga, Kings of War 2nd Edition, Deadzone: Infestation, The Walking Dead: All Out War and DreadBall Second Edition.

We currently have four outstanding Kickstarters awaiting completion: the remaining Warpath vehicles are shipping to backers now, wave two of Star Saga: The Eiras Contract is currently going into production and is expected to ship shortly afterwards, TerrainCrate will begin shipping in May/June, and for Kings of War: Vanguard the miniatures are in tooling and resin is already in production ready for later this year.

REFUNDS

Upon request refunds may be given within 30 days of the campaign ending, including fees. Following that time, refunds may be given minus Kickstarter and payment fees. In order to request a refund you must contact support@manticgames.com

TERMS AND CONDITIONS

By backing this campaign you acknowledge that the components, artwork and game elements for Hellboy: The Board Game are subject to approval by Dark Horse Comics and Mike Mignola. This means some elements may differ from those shown here following the Kickstarter campaign.

If you do not complete the pledge manager within the time specified when the pledge manager is sent, you agree that your contribution to the campaign was a donation and your pledge is fulfilled. Of course, we will use our discretion on a case by case basis. Completing the pledge manager is the ONLY way for us to confirm your shipping address and pledge details, as well as making sure we hit the production timelines. 

By pledging on this Kickstarter you agree that will pay for any shipping and any import or other duties required in your country. You also accept that you are liable for providing us with the correct shipping details upon request and we are not responsible for items lost in transit if sending to an incorrectly provided address. We also cannot ship to PO boxes and you must provide an alternative shipping in this circumstance.

Although we are aiming to deliver Hellboy: The Board Game to Kickstarter backers before the game is available at retail, production and shipping delays can lead to delivery at the same time or following the retail release. 

If you do not agree to these terms, then please purchase the game once it's available at your friendly local gaming store in 2019.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
Nickelodeon's Splat Attack! is a fast and frantic food fighting board game for 2 to 4 players, designed by Jonathan Ying (Star Wars Imperial Assault, Doom The Board Game). Featuring characters from SpongeBob Squarepants, Invader Zim, Hey Arnold!, and Rugrats!
In Splat Attack, players will take control of a team of 4 characters, grab a hand of food cards, and load up their team with Cool Points. Cool Points range in value from 0 to 3 points, and can be stolen from your characters when they get hit with food! However, additional Cool Points can be collected by reaching key locations on the game board.
When hit with food, splat tokens must be placed on the defending character. Placing these tokens strategically will be key to your success, as your character's grid space is limited. Once a character's grid is fill, the character is splatted and out of the game.
Players that are able to get the last hit in and splat a character, earn a golden Cool Point. Once the last golden Cool Point is taken, the game ends, and all players add up their Cool Points to determine a winner.
Each team is fighting to have the most Cool Points at the end of a Food Fight!  
Each turn, you can activate two different characters, and those characters can each perform two actions.   
A MOVE action allows a character to move a number of spaces equal to their SPEED rating.  
A GATHER Action allows a character to draw 2 food cards and pick up any Cool Point tokens they find in their space!  
A THROW action allows a character to throw food at a rival character! Some Food cards have special effects and abilities! 
You can Throw food at any opponent within your Range. Roll a number of dice equal to that food card’s Splat Rating plus your character’s Aim Rating. 
If you roll at least 1 Hit Result the throw hits the target! Your target must pull a splatter tile from the bag matching the food card’s splat rating. 
The target must place that splatter tile on their character grid. They must cover 1 space for each hit result the throwing character rolled.  
Then, take 1 Cool Point token from the target. However, if the target’s grid is completely full, or they can’t fit the tile on their grid, the target is SPLAT and you gain a SUPER Cool Point token instead!    
Once the last Super Cool point token is claimed, the game ends! The player with the most points at the end wins!  
Game play tips from game designer Jonathan Ying:
Nickeoldeon's Splat Attack is a frantic game of throwing food and scoring points, but there can be a method to the madness if you can play strategically. Given that it’s a free for all game it can often be a wise course of action to focus on not making too many enemies or being perceived as too great a threat! The last thing you want is to have other players teaming up against you.
Temporary alliances can be very useful if you can get your rivals to work with you to take down a player who seems to be running away with the game. Many characters have special abilities that allow them to assist their teammates, like how Phoebe can use her ability to protect her friends. But remember, you can also use her ability to help out a character on a different team to prevent another opponent from scoring or perhaps as leverage to discourage the player you helped from attacking you in the future!
Be wary of stacking up Danger tokens, they allow you to perform some pretty incredible feats, but they make your character a much juicier target! Also, when you take a hit from an opponent who is behind, it might be a good idea to let them take a danger token or two from your grid. That way they won't ALL go to the player who ends up splatting you!
Character and Team play tips from Jonathan Ying:
You should learn your team’s strengths and weaknesses and position accordingly. Each character has a number of unique abilities that can synergize in interesting ways. For example, Arnold’s ability to allow his allies to perform additional actions is very useful when both Helga and Gerald can do unique tricks when they Throw food.
Befitting a seasoned fry-cook, Spongebob Squarepants is a versatile character who can both move fast and draw food cards quickly for his team, Meanwhile, Sandy is a dangerous opponent in close quarters with her mastery of Kay-Rah-Tay. Use Patrick’s ability to shove rival characters closer to Sandy and use Squidward’s bad luck to your advantage by having him soak up splatter tiles and keep his allies fresh for longer.
Those Rugrats are always finding their way into crazy adventures! Tommy’s bonus action is an incredibly useful tool for giving his team an edge, he’s the only character who can reliably perform THREE attacks in a given round. To supplement his otherwise low skill ratings (I mean, to be fair, he’s one year old.) Suzie can use her ability to assist in his mobility while Angelica can steal food from nearby characters!
Zim’s team is all about hitting hard and causing chaos for their opponents. GIR is the fastest character in the game and can charge into the enemy ranks while Zim, Dib and Gaz throw a barrage of snack foods into the mix. You’ll want to get Zim into position quickly so he can perform his bonus attacks at the end of your turn, meanwhile Dib requires some careful play to tempo his unique action economy. Gaz is your trump card, she’s a solid character for your backline but after she’s taken a few hits and lost her Cool (points) she’ll go berserk and wreak havoc with incredibly high mobility, range, and accuracy!
PLEASE NOTE: All backers that have selected retailer pledges will be required to have to provide our fulfillment hub with a store address in order to recieve their pledge.

 Game Designer - Jonathan Ying
Jonathan Ying is a game designer and author currently operating out of San Diego California. His design credits include Star Wars: Imperial Assault, Game of Thrones: the Trivia Game, DOOM the Board Game, and Bargain Quest!
In addition to games, his interests include comic books, tabletop RPGs and of course watching a truly alarming amount of TV animation. Honestly, he can barely remember how to perform long division but he can tell you with absolute certainty the name of Gargamel’s cat in the Smurfs animated TV show.
Game Artist - Troy Little
Three time Eisner nominee and Harvey nominee, Troy began a career in animation after graduating from the Interpretive Illustration course at Sheridan College in Ontario, Canada. In 2000 he began self-publishing his comic series Chiaroscuro which garnered him both a Xeric and PEICA grant and was eventually collected by IDW Publishing in 2007.
His second book, Angora Napkin was published in 2009 with IDW and was nominated for the prestigious Eisner Award (Best Publications for Teens) in 2010. Angora Napkin was also developed as an animated pilot for Teletoon, Canada which was broadcast Halloween night in 2010.
His comic credits also include shorts and cover work on Judge Dredd, X-Files, Uncle Grandpa, The Amazing World of Gumball, Diablo House, Animal Noir and more.
Troy lives in Charlottetown, Prince Edward Island with his twin daughters Alicen, Hayden and son Nathan. He is married to comic artist Brenda Hickey.

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
IDW Games has successfully Kickstarted 7 campaigns and has already fulfilled 5 of those campaigns. Of our 2 outstanding campaigns, Masque of the Red Death has completed production and estimated to deliver on time, while Munchkin Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles is currently in sampling for final production.

IDW Games, a division of IDW Publishing, has been publishing games into retail via standard distribution channels for over 5 years.

All of our games are manufactured in China, and as such there are a few issues that could potentially slow the delivery of our campaign. The most common issues are production delays due to plastic quality, shipping delays due to vessel schedules and weather, and customs clearance when the goods come into America.

While we have never had any of the above-mentioned delays vastly affect our delivery of a final product, there is always the potential that one of these things could cause a delay in the delivery of pledges of this campaign to backers. When these types of delays do affect campaigns, we're quick to update backers with the current situation.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
*THIS CAMPAIGN'S CONTENT IS A KICKSTARTER EXCLUSIVE AND THESE SETS WILL NOT BE AVAILABLE AT RETAIL! (This is your chance to participate in this celebration!) 
Missed the campaign? You can enter our Late Pledge Manager by clicking the above image. The Late Pledge Manager opens May 8th, and supplies are limited.
Now the whole Street Fighter Universe is literally at your fingertips! What are you waiting for?!  
Help Ryu on his journey to surpass all Stretch Goals! Each one we unlock is added to your pledge for Free! We've planned for 12 additional fighters & battle decks to be unlocked during the campaign! With all those unlocked you get TRIPLE the size of a Base Pledge at the Street Fighter Level!
We wanted to make our miniatures so good that even if you didn't play the game at all, your pledge would still be fully worth it for these impressive works of art alone - and at their Collectors Scale, they are wonderful pieces to display around your home or office!  
Street Fighter: The Miniatures Game uses a unique scale, the brand new "Collector's Scale"! This giant-sized scale has your models large and in charge from 65mm tall all the way up to 85mm tall on some characters all on a standardized 58mm base! We will be offering this scale for all our future Universal Tactics System Games.   
This size offers tons of advantages:
The miniatures are more like small collectable statues and makes them great for displaying around the house even if you don't play the game at all!  
The larger the mini the better the pre-paint process, our pre-painted miniatures are simply the best the industry can currently offer, rivalling that of action figures and full sized collector statues!  
Playing with larger miniatures on a board with 3D terrain gives amazing table presence when you pull this game out at any gathering! You'll be the talk of the town!  
We believe its quality over quantity, why have buckets of tiny miniatures if they don't get played packed away in expansion box after expansion box? These miniatures will get a lot of table time as your sole representation on the battlefield!  
Take a look at our featured miniatures video below!
Let us get a detailed look at each one of our fighters included in the Core Set!
Adding a NEW DIMENSION to Street Fighter!  
Destructible Stage Terrain adds a new exciting element to the Street Fighter experience and it adds a new layer of strategic depth to the game as you attempt to out outmaneuver your opponent and set them up for extra damage!  
Each round the terrain is reset and the fighter positions swapped as to offer an equal opportunity to both players, plus its just more fun to crash into more stuff. Smart awareness, positioning and baiting your opponent can easily win you the day!  
HOW TO PLAY THE GAME. IT'S SIMPLE!  
We wanted anyone to be able to jump right in and play! So we had to make learning the game simple, but yet still have the depth to please experienced gamers and fighting game fans. This was an extremely challenging task for sure, especially when you consider the game system is built not only for Versus Mode but also Free for All and Team Games, essentially three games in one! However after 2 years of development we've believe we have found the right balance between accessibility, strategy, luck and fun factor!  
It's as Simple as.... DRAW. MOVE. FIGHT!
1. DRAW! - Draw 2 cards from your Battle Deck as you start your turn. Skipping this only for the first turn you take.
2. MOVE! - Move your character up to their Movement Value in any direction.
3. FIGHT! - Take 2 Actions in any order and in any amount from these Actions:  MOVE, DRAW, or PLAY A CARD.
On defense your choice is even easier but yet still an important tension filled decision. Do you BLOCK or COUNTER-ATTACK?
BLOCK - Roll two default Battle Dice and apply results vs opponent's attack roll.  You may also discard certain cards with defensive dice values to "BOOST" your Block Roll.
-OR-
COUNTER-ATTACK - Play a Counter for a Strike, Special or Projectile, if successful discard opponents card and perform Counter-Attack Ability, usually causing damage during your opponents turn!
And that's how the game works! 
As you roll your Battle Dice & play your cards you will gain meter results which contribute to your Meter Gauge allowing you to enhance certain attacks or save these for the powerful Super and Ultra Combos that can finish your opponents instantly! Best 2 rounds out of 3 WINS!
 CLICK THE IMAGE BELOW TO DOWNLOAD THE BETA RULEBOOK!
Click the Image above to Download the BETA Rulebook!
The Boss Expansion adds in two extremely powerful Street Fighter Bosses. The power level of these bosses is so immense that other players will need to team-up to defeat them in a near hopeless final battle! Here's what's in the set in more detail!  
Street Fighter: The Miniatures Game Boss Expansion includes everything you need to introduce extremely powerful Boss characters. This expansion also includes the Boss Mode game rules in which one player controls the boss in a battle against a team of three rival players! Can you and your friends stop this evil-doer's dastardly plan?  
BOSS EVENT DECKS  
Every Boss comes with a unique Event Deck that can change the battlefield conditions dramatically, forcing the players to cooperate and strategize to deal with the new threat! Each new boss game is a different experience as only 6 to 8 of these events are drawn each game on average!
BOSS FIGHTER BATTLE DECKS
In addition to the Boss Mode, the Boss Expansion includes normal 40-Card Boss-Fighter Decks so that the boss can join in with the rabble and fight on a more even level with their opponents in Versus, Free For All, and Team Modes!
If you would like to purchase any of these optional add-on's, please click the "Manage Your Pledge" button on this games Kickstarter Page and in the pledge manager add the total amount of the items you'd like to get to your total pledge. Our Custom Pledge Manager sent out later will then allow you to pick the specific add-on's you'd like before checkout!

This Kickstarter is a celebration of over 30 years of the greatest fighting game franchise of all-time! Please enjoy this Documentary detailing the history of the game from the 25th Anniversary!  
We view this as a premium product for fans of Street Fighter, tabletop games and collectable products. The costs of manufacturing a game like this are extremely high due to a number of factors including:  
Individual "Collector Sized" pre-painted special FX's miniatures that are comparable in size to ("Nintendo Amiibos") that can retail for around $14.99 each! And we are packing 8 of them into a single box! 24 in the World Warrior Pledge!
We have planned at least 12 Stretch Goal Fighter Miniatures and their Battle Decks as unlocks, each one of these are at no cost to our backers! This cuts heavily into our margins and makes offering this many free mini's impossible at Retail! So get them while you can!
This game has among the highest number of full sized top quality playing cards in a single tabletop game ever! 428 cards in the Street Fighter Pledge and each new character unlocked in Stretch Goals adds another 40 cards, an extremely expensive and costly inclusion! With all Stretch Goals unlocked and the World Warrior pledge that's over 1,548 cards! A ridiculous amount and again impossible at Retail!
Countless pieces of professional & unique artwork for each type of attack and event cards in a Character Deck!
The only way a game like this is made possible is to sell directly to our passionate backers who are looking for a premium and high-quality product. As lifelong fans of the franchise, we simply wanted to make the best possible game regardless of the cost! So jump in on this exclusive opportunity, you never know how valuable these limited pieces can become in the future!
If demand is extremely high we may consider in the far future making a retail version of the game with a lower amount of miniatures, perhaps unpainted and at a smaller scale.
If you miss the kickstarter the game may only be available at conventions and direct from Jasco Games in limited quantities.

campaign.story:
In a cyberpunk, dystopian future, the citizens of Paris Nouveau are no more than indentured servants. Virtual reality has come at a cost they can never pay, a tradeoff of freedom for technology. But there are freedom fighters who reject the system, unplugging from the illusion and working to make things right once again. They are la Résistance. 
Rise up and defy the corporations in the Uprising: The Dystopian Universe RPG, set in the same universe as The Resistance, Coup, and One Night Revolution from Indie Boards & Cards.
Are you already a backer? Then go to this backers-only post and download the latest copy of Uprising right now!
Found a typo or other error in the draft? Let us know! We're collecting them here.
Looking to support a local retailer by preordering Uprising through them? Encourage your FLGS to back us and get their copies early!
Uprising is the roleplaying game based on the hit Dystopian Universe (DU) games from Indie Boards & Cards, including The Resistance, Coup, and One Night Revolution. Like the other DU games, Uprising is about cunning spies and government agents, loyalty and betrayal, propaganda, unrest, and violent revolution. Unlike the other games, it’s a roleplaying game or RPG. Uprising uses a modified version of the Fate Core rules. You’ll step into the identities behind the cards—or make your own—and foment rebellion, betray close friends, aid enemies, and hopefully survive the dark and gritty streets of Paris Nouveau.

An RPG? What’s that?  
In a roleplaying game, all of the players work together to tell a story--in this case, one about the lives of revolutionaries in the cyberpunk world of Paris Nouveau. Most of the players are PCs or player characters. These players decide what their character will do in response to what's happening in game. One person at the table will be the Game Master or GM. This player decides what the opposition and supporting characters do. When a character takes action, the player will roll the dice to see how successful (or unsuccessful) that effort is, but the real fun is in deciding together what happens next.
Your cyberpunk Paris experience may vary.
  What if I’ve never played an RPG before?
You're in luck! RPGs are a lot of fun, and we've made special effort to insure this one is accessible to fans of the other DU games who might never have tried an RPG. Inside, you'll find the following beginner-friendly elements:
Character archetypes based on familiar DU cards – Ever look at the cards during a game of Coup: Rebellion G54 and wonder what the Aristocrat or the General was thinking? This is your chance to find out first-hand!
Beginner-friendly instructions – All this group storytelling sounds great, but what exactly do you do? This book lays it all out, along with an example of how it would play at the table.
Character playsheets – Like the other DU games, all of the characters fall into familiar types. Pick a playsheet, customize it, and get playing quickly.
Sample missions - To help out new GMs (and anyone short on time!), we’ve provided a series of pre-made missions. All the pieces, plot points, and characters are provided!
Step into the Dystopian Universe

I’m a Fate fanatic! What’s in it for me?
For gamers familiar with Fate, Uprising offers some new and exciting mechanics—not to mention that compelling cyberpunk setting. Inside, you’ll find the following new elements:
Secrets – Fate Core is built around camaraderie and teamwork, but at its core, the Dystopian Universe is full of backstabbing and deceit. Uprising provides a mechanical system for in-character secrets that will keep everyone at the table guessing.
Prep scenes – Do more with your downtime than just refreshing your Fate pool with the new prep scene rules. Request favors, requisition equipment, and create advantages to use later.
New action rules – Instead of skills or approaches, Uprising uses means—Fight, Manipulate, Maneuver, and Observe. Adjust the outcome depending on whether the means fit the end goal.
Advancement system – Instead of milestones, character-specific goals lead to character growth—and sometimes put the characters at odds with each other.
In Paris Nouveau, danger lurks around every corner.
At KS launch, we’ve already got a laid out copy of the game, which you can download immediately upon pledging. We're still finishing up the art, and we'll be sharing the development of the last few pieces with you throughout this Kickstarter! Next steps include proofing (which you can help with by downloading the instant PDF and reporting any problems here), finishing up that art, and print production.
Our current timeline has Kickstarter fulfillment happening in December 2018, but we're looking at possibilities to shave some time off of that. Of course we’ll keep you notified of how we’re doing at every step of the process. We’re rather proud of our track record when it comes to prompt KS fulfillment and excellent customer service, and, as always, we’re committed to making this KS a positive experience for our backers.
The PDF: As a backer of this project at any level, you'll get immediate access to the early preview PDF before the Kickstarter campaign concludes. We're doing this because we want to make it easy for you to decide if this game is for you, particularly if you’re new to RPGs. It also gives you a chance to provide us critical feedback that will improve the game in its final form. We’ll update the final PDF for backers at the $20 level and up, as soon as that’s available. But folks who don't back this project will have to wait a few months before they'll get their hands on that.
Please note that you'll see some art placeholders in the book (outlines or blank boxes). If that wasn't clear above, we'll be filling those in with the remaining art once it's done.
The Hardcover Book: Those backing at $39 and higher will receive a 6"x9", hardcover, 310 page, full color version of Uprising: The Dystopian Universe RPG. Shipping late 2018.
Digital Bonuses: All backers at $20 and higher will receive a download link to a digital bonus pack. This downloadable folder of awesomeness will include copies of Fate Core, Fate Accelerated, Venture City (our superhero flavored cyberpunk supplement), and Designers & Dragons: The 70’s (the first volume in our four book history of the RPG industry), plus sample chapters from recent releases Fate Adversary Toolkit, Dresden Files Accelerated, and upcoming releases Tachyon Squadron and Scum and Villainy.
UNLOCKED: POD Secrets Deck: Once we reach $10,500, we'll unlock a digital coupon code for a POD copy of the Secrets Deck from DriveThruCards for all backers at $20 and up. The book comes with printable secret cards so you can get playing immediately (and you'll be able to download a clean PDF of them from our website), but we'd like to offer a more durable card option. The code will allow you to purchase the POD version at cost (around $1.22 based on our current quote, as opposed to the $5-or-so we'll charge outside of this KS) plus shipping.
UNLOCKED: Paris Nouveau Corporate Catalog: Once we reach this funding goal, we'll unlock the Corporate Catalog supplement for all backers at $20 and up. This electronic-only, approximately 5000 word supplement will include more corporations to act as foils, antagonists, or uneasy allies; equipment produced by each corporation to provide an easy PC-purchase list; and additional corp-specific implants and contacts.
UNLOCKED: Safehouses and Hotspots: At $23K, all backers at $20 and up will unlock the Safehouses and Hotspots supplement. This electronic-only, approximately 4000 word supplement will include 2-page spreads with ready-made encounters that the GM can drop into existing missions. GMs can also repurpose the included NPC stats for use in a home-brew mission.
UNLOCKED: The Second Fall and Other Stories: Our next stretch goal is for The Second Fall and Other Stories, which will be available to all backers at $20 and up. Many of the missions in the core book are stand-alone, but some connect into a loose story arc. This downloadable, approximately 5000 word supplement will provide additional story arcs, each broken down into six connected missions. These can be chained together or run as a ready-made campaign. Once we unlock this goal, we’ll start writing!
UNLOCKED: Beyond the Walls: Once we unlock this stretch goal, we’ll start working on the Beyond the Walls, which will be available to all backers at $20 and up. This supersized supplement (at approximately 10,000 words) will focus on a new city beyond the walls of Paris Nouveau, with a different style of oppression. It will include a setting write up, a trio of missions, and a new social class with three new playsheets.
UNLOCKED: Invisible Hands: The Black Market: Once we unlock this stretch goal, we’ll start working on the Invisible Hands supplement, which will be available to all backers at $20 and up. This 5000 word electronic supplement will give you a look at the underbelly of Paris Nouveau—with echoes of the Grifters of the Dystopian Universe. It will include new underworld contacts and plenty of illegal tech to fuel your campaigns.
UNLOCKS AT $52,000: Upfrancisco Uprising: Once we unlock this stretch goal, we’ll start working on a profile of Upfrancisco. Take your Uprising campaign to an entirely new setting and country with this 10,000 word electronic supplement. It will include a setting write up, a trio of missions, and a new social class with three new playsheets.
As with our other recent Kickstarters, we're charging a flat $6 shipping fee.  This also allows us to subsidize the shipping a bit--the actual S&H costs will be more than the $6 we're charging you.
We'll also be using BackerKit, where you'll also be able to configure your rewards. BackerKit is a pledge manager--a separate website that gives you (and us!) greater control over what happens after the campaign than a simple survey would. You'll also have the option to add on a few select items via the BackerKit if you choose to do so, with no extra shipping costs.
We’ve made the difficult decision not to offer international shipping in this Kickstarter. To put it simply—the shipping costs our distributors are able to offer is as much or more than the products we’d ship. We can’t in good conscience ask you to pay it. However, we still want international folks to be able to get their hands on the goodies. You can try a freight forwarder or a friendly American willing to forward the shipment to you. If that's not feasible for you, we've made it a point to make all of the materials available in an international-friendly electronic tier to make sure you can join the uprising no matter where you live. And of course we'll make the book available in international distribution, when we get to that point.

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Evil Hat is an experienced RPG publisher. We've printed many role-playing games in a variety of physical formats over the past few years—twelve in the past two years alone. This puts us in a fine position to take on the risks and challenges that will arise. Experience tells us that things don’t always go as planned.

Here's what we can anticipate as potential problems.

The Art: The art could take longer to execute than we're hoping it will, or could simply manifest in a fashion we find unsatisfactory (requiring a 'do-over'). Artists are people with real lives and those lives come with schedule-complicating problems. If any delay looks like it will be short, we'll likely roll with it, and we'll let you know what's up. If it looks like something long, we have an assortment of other artists we've worked with over the years who we know can execute quickly and on-time for a deadline.

The Text: While the editing, layout, and playtesting of Uprising is largely done, it's possible that you will identify some glaring issue that we need to address before we take this fully to publication. That can add time, for sure. Luckily we have several talented writers available if we need a fix, as well as layout and editing people on standby, so any necessary changes should proceed quickly.

Printing: We have a strong, established relationship with our printers. We’ve got them on tap to print the books in whatever quantity we end up needing. But printers can run into problems all the same: supply shortages, unexpected delays due to company holidays or industry events, shipping problems, printing errors, and so on. We’ve got the experience to stay atop those potential problems and the flexibility to pivot and address them promptly. In the event of defective product, we will send a replacement at no cost to you.

Shipping: Packages get lost. We'll send replacements. Shipping can take longer than expected. We won't put the book on sale until they've shipped out all backer copies. Shipping costs can end up higher than expected. We'll absorb the overage.

Finances: Thanks to the success of the Dresden Files RPG and our other projects, Evil Hat is a perhaps atypically solvent RPG company. We've already invested time and money to get Uprising to this point, and our bank account continues to look plenty healthy. If an unexpected cost arises, we've got the cushion to take the hit.

If there's any risk or challenge YOU can think of that we haven't mentioned here, please write in and ask. We love to answer questions, and we do our best to provide an unparalleled customer service experience whenever possible. We intend to impress you.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
It's BackerKit launch day! 
To the folks who've used BackerKit with other campaigns before: the BackerKit will launch later today, starting with a smoke test (5% of backers get invites to help kick the tires) and followed later in the day by full rollout. 
To everyone else: The rest of this post is here to help you. Lots of words, yes, but I'm trying to head off questions at the pass here, so make sure to read all of them! I'll try to keep each part as brief as possible.

The stretch goals for Uprising are complete! 
We've bundled them all together in a single collection we've titled Revolutionary Messages. You'll find new gear, contacts, story arcs, missions, settings, and playbooks inside. We thank you for your loyalty.

We've launched the Agon kickstarter today! Whenever we launch a new project, we like to make sure we're checking in with our other Kickstarters that aren't fully finished yet.
Since we last updated you, the text of all the stretch goals has been edited and revised until it stopped complaining and started cooperating like all good citizens should. (We're bundling all the stretches together in one PDF, so it will contain Paris Nouveau Corporate Catalog, The Second Fall and Other Stories, Invisible Hands: The Black Market, Beyond the Walls, and Safehouses and Hotspots.)

Hi all! It's been a year since this campaign concluded, and I figured that's plenty reason to post an update on its own—thank you all for making this game possible!—but there are tidbits to share with you as well, so, bonus words commence. 
I'll keep them brief, regardless. You never know who's listening in.
First up, some exciting news—Uprising was nominated for an Origins Award! The winner will be determined at Origins itself next month. Hope to see you (and your vote) in attendance there — we'll be a part of the Indie Press Revolution (IPR) booth, as always, so please do drop on by.

Greetings Citoyens,
We don’t have much time. We’ve hacked the feed, but the government tracers will be on us soon. This is an alert that future transmissions are on their way, which will be sent to you using an old Portable Document Format (PDF) that we believe should make its way through the feed undetected. Here’s our current status:
Paris Nouveau Corporate Catalog - 75% Complete. Writing and editing complete. Layout and art development to follow once the entire packet is buffered into the feed.

It's not yet August, but here's the plan for that month!
The books have arrived at the warehouse. (I'm waiting on my own copies, but I'll try to share pictures when I get them.)
We plan to start shipping shortly after GenCon (which is the second half of next week).
To get things ready for that, we are locking down orders and charging cards in BackerKit so folks have an opportunity to correct any errors in advance of the shipping effort starting. If any error is encountered, BackerKit will email you (so far it looks like only 6 of the charges on file have run into problems).

This coming Monday (July 9th) we will begin rolling out the Uprising RPG BackerKit (pledge configurer & shipping information manager) for this project. We'll post another update then with guidance and instructions. 
Please keep an eye out on Monday for the update! Our intent is to begin the shipping effort by mid August (if not earlier), assuming all goes well with the print job currently underway. Quick responses will help make sure we get this all done at the best possible speed. :)

Hello all! Super quick update for you, as we don't want to let you get any later into June without an update on this project's status. Here are the facts.
We got in the physical proof, but a number of images were printing too dark to see some of the subtle-dark-shades-differences in the images. As Paris Nouveau is a setting full of shadows, getting printing fidelity on those images is important!
We revised those images, lightening them just enough to get the darker shades to show up, and had the printer re-proof the whole thing.

We are doing the happy dance at Evil Hat Central. (Well, honestly, it’s the happy flail. As a company, epic dance moves aren’t our specialty.) Thanks to all of you, we’ve got Uprising on the way, plus 29,000 words worth of additional electronic content, plus the POD secrets deck coupon, plus an Evil Hat prize pack full of electronic goodies.
That’s a lot of plusses.
And a lot of flailing. We’re all kind of like Kermit over here, only a little less green. 
Carrie?
