campaign.story:
New and last stretch goal... 
LV10 now gets you 13 BP miniatures of your choice! 55% Off MSRP
THE PROJECT
Over the past decade I have directly assisted multiple miniature companies achieve success with their projects. I have both broad and lengthy experience in the miniature industry. My previous work has covered all aspects of miniature production from design to manufacturing, and ranges from working with metal to resin and also plastic materials. Now I am creating my own line of high quality figures and am asking for your help to meet my goals. This project will begin with 10 figures and will expand to add more figures, add-ons, and freebies. If a picture is worth a thousand words than these images should speak for themselves.
Thank you for your interest and support!
THE MODELS
These are the BP (Base Pledge) models available with perks from LV1 to LV11. Based on your level you can choose any combination of models from the 13 available below.  
More models available to select
ADD-ON
The models below can not be choose as one of the models in the various pledge, but can be added only as an Add-On. Just add the corresponding amount to your pledge and you will choose the ones you want with the pledge manager.
 STRETCH GOALS
 PLEDGES 
STL PLEDGE:
This pledge grants you the STL files for the 14 BP models uploaded in the page Ildyn to Sister Mary. No KS exclusive models are included in the offer. The files from Ursula to Jade Devil will all be available for an extra 6$ each.

If you pledged for LV10 or above the STL files are a $60 Add-On. You save 10$
3D Printed Big Sisters Perks:
This perk is a KS exclusive and will never be available again after this KS.
Selecting this perk will entitle you based on the amount pledged to get a high definition printed model in the size you prefer. Each model will be printed using a Form Lab 2 printer at his max resolution in light gray resin.
At the end of the KS in the pledge manager you will be asked the exact size you want and we will print the model for you.
 Printed with a FormLab2 printer. The end result is amazing... 
70mm model
RETAILERS Perk:
Retailers can select the 100$ perk. Minimum order will be 500$. The initial 100$ will be counted in the 500$ minimum order.
Retailers discount will apply. Retailers must be actual retailers. For more details please feel free to contact us.
All retailers models will come with appropriate packaging for display.
Freebies are not counted in this perk.
SHIPPING
Shipping costs for rewards will be charged after the campaign and added in the pledge manager. This approach allows us to charge only the actual shipping costs incurred, which will vary based on how many miniatures you take. For 10 or more miniatures the shipping price will be for DHL Worldwide Shipping, with a delivery time between 3 and 5 days. Online tracking will be provided.
We are now also Canada and Australia friendly shipping!
What does this mean? Well we will charge each backer only 1$ for shipping + local Canadian service. This should make shipping cost lower for you and will not involve import taxes. Why? Well we will be paying the taxes for you. New updated prices coming soon for AU and CA!
Estimated delivery date?
Estimated delivery for this project is May/June 2018. There may be minor delays caused by factors that are not under our control such as factory delays, customs, or an additional miniature unlocked late in the campaign. However, please note that we are confident that delays, if any at all, will be brief.
THE DESIGN PROCESS
Our team has many years of experience in miniature design and production. We understand that there is no better way to judge the quality of a model than to hold it in your own hand. The proportions and every detail of a model are best experienced in person. Drawing from our experience and utilizing the best techniques and methods available we stick to the following in order to achieve the best results for each of our models.

1 - DETAILS - Yes, a rendered image looks great, but how well will it paint? We balance details by not overcrowding them and knowing that simple clean lines will produce better finished results both in production and painting.
2 - RENDERS - Renders are just the beginning. All of our models are printed at a high quality for evaluation after they are initially designed. We inspect these test prints to ensure that details and proportions are as intended before committing them to production.
3 - SCALE - Not too big not too small -  We want our models to be compatible with the majority of game systems currently on the market. Presently the most common scale has become 32mm. 
4 - PRODUCTION - It is not easy to produce the high quality of detail that we aim for in resin models. Knowledge, experience and dedication come together to enable us to achieve this goal. A significant part of our success in production starts in the design process. clean lines and the right quantity of individual pieces enable a higher quality of production.
5 - MATERIAL - For this project we have selected some of the highest quality resin available on the market. Our resin will withstand heat and will also be as flexible as possible. All to help your models avoid actual damage on the battlefield.

6 - UNIQUENESS - One thing we've learned is that each model is different and we approach every new piece with the understanding and expectation that it must be optimized in a unique way. We could write a book covering all of the considerations that come into play for each model, but instead we will just put that experience to work.
ACTUAL PAINTED MODELS
The models below are actual miniatures painted by various artists, they are not colored 3D render images.
PAINTING OFFERS
Blue Table Painting has offered a deal to get the models painted.
Any order that will be sent to them will get:
1) Priority Shipping - Gets shipped First
2) FREE Shipping (we pay shipping to them)
Blue Table Painting offers:
1) No assembly fee saves you 6$ each model
2) Discounted Rates (Only level 5 or superior) 

L = Level (L5 = Level 5) you can see the corresponding quality on BTP website. 
VIDEOS FROM PAINTERS
SIZE COMPARISON
Courtesy of Den of Imagination, this picture shows the actual model next to other brand miniatures for scale comparison.
  Games Workshop models shown only for scale purposes, no association is intended.
SOCIAL MEDIA STRETCH GOALS
Reaching 4000 likes is not an easy task, but if we do all backers from Lv1 and above will get the STL file to print their own Heresy Walls.
Walls were used for the Lady of Decay Box Art picture below:
The walls are original designs by: WARLAYER
SO HOW DOES IT ALL WORK?
Once we have raised the funds to reach our funding goal, the models will be produced at the end of the campaign.
However, reaching the funding goal is not the end!
The campaign will continue beyond the basic rewards of the project and the more people who join the project, the more stretch goals will be unlocked.
The beauty of crowdfunding on Kickstarter is that you can choose how much to spend at any time during the project. This means you can join the project and pledge to get all the rewards of the campaign and are still free to change your mind until the very last minute of the campaign. Conversely, if you like our  models you could join with one of the lower pledges and then decide to change your pledge and get a more expensive pledge or add-ons instead. You don't have to worry about choosing the right option, because you can change your pledge at any time. After the funding goal is reached we will announce new stretch goals for the project. The stretch goals will either unlock new add-ons or add free items to your existing pledge, so the more people who join the project the more free items you will get without having to spend. This is a very good reason to help us spread the word on social media and in your own community of gamers. If your friends join the project then both you and they will benefit from it at no additional cost.
LINKS
Late Backers
Don't want to use a credit card? Or want to join at a later time? Just visit our store and buy the Entry Level for 1$ you will be added to the pledge manager when ready.

I have participated in several successfully completed crowdfunding projects in the past and I am confident that rewards will be delivered. 
In crowdfunding projects there are always certain variables that could escape the initial plan. As a consequence there is always the possibility of a delay in delivery. These delays are typically caused by last minute additions to the campaign, such as new Stretch Goals, or are a delay within the shipping process itself such as problems with customs releasing the goods, or a delay by one or more manufacturers involved in the project.

campaign.story:
In 2016 we launched our first Kickstarter project and we got an astounding response from the amazing Kickstarter community. 1800 believers from 55 countries saw our vision of creating high quality executive novelties and turned our vision to a reality. Now we are back on Kickstarter with our second product to continue this journey where it was started.
It’s mind bending to see water levitate on Earth because of gravity of course. Well, as you may know from our previous Kickstarter project, we like to tease gravity. So, we’re pleased to announce our next product, LeviZen, the mind blowing liquid levitator!
We’d like to think that LeviZen brings outer space on your desk by giving you the chance to experience water in zero gravity in person for the first time. Meticulously crafted from fine walnut wood and precision machined aluminum, LeviZen is fundamentally a liquid levitator using high frequency sound waves which are not audible to our ears.
When observed, water is a magical material, it’s formless and it adapts it’s shape to the object it’s poured in. But when it’s suspended in the air, its character is unveiled and all of a sudden you can see water for the first time.
Let’s take up a notch. Not only LeviZen can levitate water and liquids in general, it can make them light up in the air as well. The two spot LEDs placed in the base of the levitator targeted right at the levitating drop, make the drop glow like a light source as if the light itself is levitating.
PLAY

PLAY

We believe a product should express the owner by its design and functionality. Besides it’s mind boggling properties we want your LeviZen to aesthetically make you proud showcasing it on your work desk, coffee table, end table, or a bookshelf.
To make the design as awesome as it’s functionality, we decided to give LeviZen a retro look by using walnut wood with CNC machined and hand finished aluminum. Then, we put all the electronics in a separate box, called it “The Box” and added three retro toggle switches for Power on/off, Light on/off, and moving the water drop up and down while it’s levitating. We added an all aluminum knob for controlling the power level, a retro 7 segment display to show the power level, and rounded the top two corners just the right amount that LeviZen looked like a retro amplifier and stereo set in a quick glance. We are proud of our LeviZen sitting on our desk defying gravity by levitating water drops and we are sure you will too when you experience owning a LeviZen.
The Box is the control center for the levitating drop. Every liquid levitates at a different level. The denser the liquid is the more power it needs to levitate. For this, we added an all Aluminum metal knob that organically changes the power level by a simple turn while the 7 segmented display shows the resting power level. LeviZen not only can levitate liquids, it also can move the drop up and down while its levitating by one of the the three metal toggle switches on The Box. The other two toggle switches are the main power on/off and the light on/off controls.  
Levitating multiple drops of water by LeviZen:
PLAY

Moving the Levitating drop up and down by using the top toggle switch on the Box:
PLAY

LeviZen levitates water using two identical sound waves that travel against each other which together create a standing wave. This wave has places on it where it does not move at all while all the other places of this wave move at maximum level. These non-moving places are called nodes. When a water drop is placed at the nodes, the water drop gets trapped by the standing waves' maximum moving parts beneath and above the nodes. And just like that we get a levitating water drop.
We want the world to experience water levitation. This phenomenon was invented many years ago and has been living in the science labs around the world ever since and there has not been a finished product in the market since then so everyone can simply buy and experience this surreal invention. We want to change that with LeviZen. Asier Marzo from the University of Bristol is one of the pioneers in the field of acoustic levitation and LeviZen is mostly based on one of his earlier works. We gathered all the information on sound levitation, figured out an efficient way of assembling LeviZen’s 100+ parts, gave it a beautiful retro design, added a set of bright spot LEDs to make the liquid bubble glow like a lamp to make it even more mind blowing and came up with LeviZen. Now, everything is ready and we’re ready to craft these machines so everyone around the world can experience the mind bending event of water levitation. 
Note: Asier Marzo is not affiliated in any way with LeviZen or Simplistyk and the use of his work is compliant with his research paper’s license. The Paper

updates.update_content:
Hello Simplistyk Family, 
As you know, Simplistyk is a unique kind of a company with a vision to bring cool and extraordinary products to a very unique group of backers. There is a clear reason as to why we encountered difficulties in fulfilling our previous project and why currently we are experiencing delays with LeviZen. The reason is that, established companies with big budgets and capabilities don’t dare to think of making complicated products that require the utmost precision in manufacturing for just a very small group of customers and losing a lot of money. On the other hand, small companies and startups also don’t dare to think of making these kind of products because they are aware of the extreme challenges and the risk imposed to the company with limited budget and man power. Simplistyk’s vision is and has been to break this barrier and with our determination and knowledge of precision manufacturing both in-house and working with advanced local manufacturing partners here in California and the ability to design highly efficient and intuitive assembly processes, we turned this vision to reality with our previous project and will do the same with LeviZen. All being said, we do apologize for the delay and we want you to be aware that even though we don’t share the complicated detail of our progress, we are definitely in the right path specially by the help of the flexible printed circuit boards (PCBs), the custom soldering/reflowing process, and the special multi-speaker assembly process using custom 3d fixtures. After we finished delivering our previous project, we were very proud of being able to establish a company that can actually produce very unique and high quality products for a very niche and unique market and after we finish delivering your LeviZens, we will be proud and confident that we would have the full capability to make and deliver our future projects in a timely manner. We will keep you updated of our progress and will share the details of the manufacturing and the assembly process as soon as they are finalized. Thanks again for believing in us.

updates.update_userinfo: The first and only consumer liquid levitating machine
updates.update_content: As you all know, LeviZen is our second successful project. Our first project, Spin, is a precision product that needs to be crafted and assembled perfectly to function and that’s exactly what we did and successfully made and shipped about 2000 of them to our backers. LeviZen is also a product that needs to be made with the utmost attention and the many more components of LeviZen need to be machined and made with tight tolerances to be perfectly aligned in assembly. But, a big difference that LeviZen has compared to Spin, is its assembly process because of its many parts. From individually soldering the 144 pins of the speakers to perfectly aligning the spot lights and fitting alot of electronics and wiring in the Box and the Levitator, to perfectly aligning and fastening all the individual parts together, LeviZen needs a very efficient and intuitive assembly line. We make some of the parts in-house like the machined and hand finished wooden and aluminum parts and we use our suppliers for the remaining parts. This is our first electronic product and also our first product that needs a lot of assembly besides our through quality control process. Our previous estimated assembly time for each LeviZen seems to have been very underestimated because of the complexity of LeviZen and currently we have a hold on the production of the parts until we succeed in creating a feasible in-house assembly line, and based on our previous experience, this shouldn’t take long. We are aware that we had an estimated delivery of July and we do apologize for the delay but please note that it’s a huge challenge for even an experienced company like us to manufacture and assemble a product like LeviZen with the utmost attention in California. Because of our extensive trial and error in the last two months, there is not much to show in pictures, but will include pictures in the upcoming updates as we design and finalize the new assembly process and get closer to start the production and shipping your LeviZen liquid levitating machines which is the first commercially available liquid levitator in the world and which you will receive before anyone else in the world.

We want to thank each and every one of you for your continued support and believing our vision of creating high quality executive scientific novelties. Thanks to you all, we had a great run and we are humbled by your positive feedbacks and enthusiasm for LeviZen.
We also want to note that there are still about 80 payments that has not gone through. When a payment fails, Kickstarter tries multiple times to charge the card again, so you still have time to update your card’s information before the deadline.

You’ve done it again, another campaign fully funded in just 2 days! Thank you for your continuous support, you are all amazing!
Cheers to all of our backers.
Simplistyk

campaign.story:
Picolor is a small cube with five different pigment colors which include Cyan, Magenta, Yellow, Black and White. It uses special mechanisms, which reproduce the desired color. This cube is an art-tech gadget that will make life easier for all those who intend to mix colors and find their own unique shades.
Choose your color in the mobile app and send it to Picolor using Bluetooth connection. It's so simple! Just send, mix, fill and paint.

This gadget is useful for people who enjoy creating. With the help of this tool wasting time on mixing colors or trying to figure out the right amount of shades will vanish into thin air. Now, in order to create a cool picture, you don't need dozens of markers or paints on your palette, all you need is Picolor. It will become a creative assistant for both professionals and amateurs and help develop children’s painting and drawing skills. If you are fond of drawing or painting, if you are an artist, designer or just a creative person, Picolor is an ideal solution for you!
We also plan to work with pigments with higher density. It should be noted that some paints have a higher density and drying speed, which can cause incorrect operation of the device. However, at this moment you can add the finished pigment, a result of mixing with the cube, to the higher density bases, thus getting the desired Acrylic, Nail Polishes etc. color tone.

* These capabilities of mixing colors should undergo numerous tests and trials before being implemented into release version. After the testing some mixing capabilities can be unavailable.
  We offer two colors of the product:

The application will be available for IOS and Android
Our team has launched a campaign on Kickstarter with the aim of raising $20,000. The goal of this campaign is to achieve the result which is the finished product and the start of mass production.
We need help to refine our product. That is why we are launching a Kickstarter campaign and expect your support. The next stage will be the development of the industrial design of the product, the testing of additional functions, the preparation for production and finally the production itself.
The testing will cover the mixing capabilities for a wider range of use: varnish paints for manicure and pedicure, oil paints for painting, paints for removing scratches on cars, etc.
At this stage, we humbly ask for your support for which you will be offered Picolor. Thank you for support!

Keep pace with new technologies. Choose Picolor.

updates.update_content:
Dear Backers,
The new year just rang in and we'd like to express our sincere gratitude for your confidence in us, and in our product. Best wishes for a pleasant and successful New Year!
We are very sorry to keep you waiting.
Guess we should've talked about this stuff sooner, but we had hope that we could avoid the next step. In our view, an enormous amount of work has been done. Using the funds you provided, we have managed to create a pre-production protype. But today additional funds are needed to enable full coverage of anticipated production costs. At this stage we are focused on finding an investor.

Dear Backers,

   Before we begin, we would like to thank you for the warm comments you left under the last update. This is exactly what keeps us motivated, more than anything else does. At this time, we would like to focus this update on the development timeline. As many of you have noticed, we are moving as close as possible to the published timeline. However, we have to inform you that we won’t be able to send out our product in December.
   As you know, our product uses mechanics, electronics and smartphone applications. Putting together all these constituent elements into a whole one is really hard work. And to do it with high quality is even harder work. Therefore, finalizing and testing the product will take a bit longer than expected. All major stages have been described in our updates in detail.
   In one of the following updates, we will talk about the state of development of electronics based on the cc2640 chip. The current version of the prototype uses Arduino, for quick edits in the operation of the device. But we can only use our own developments in a product that will enter the mass market. In theory, 2 + 2 = 4, but it is not always the same in practice. Every option requires thorough check. So now, we realize that some optimistic view of the time needed for testing has to be reassessed. We hope for your understanding. Let's face it, we are determined to complete this stage as soon as possible, since having a ready-made pre-production prototype should make it much easier for us to attract additional funding outside the site.

Thank you for attention,
Picolor Team

Dear Backers,

   We have completed the development of industrial design - an important and complex stage prior the pre-production prototype.

campaign.story:
A gentle breeze. The soothing sounds of a gently flowing river. The glow of the moon. A bountiful harvest. Basic human emotions such as fear and rage. Even death. They all have an unseen force guiding them. And while these forces work together to make the world what it is, they each aspire for influence over those who believe in them.
Designed by Kolossal's own AJ Lambeth, Kami-sama is a beautiful and intuitive strategy game set in rural Japan during the Edo period. Two to four players will assume the roles of Kami, the spirits of the land. Using a combination of asymmetrical player powers, area control, set collection, pattern building, and light card drafting, players will work to balance their Favor with the people and their connection to Nature in order to be crowned Kami-sama, the chief deity of the land.
        The Spirit Way add-on expansion introduces four new kami
Daikono, the kami of radishes
Kari, the kami of the hunt
Kitakori, the kami of ice
Yuma, the kami of dreams
These kami introduce new interactive strategies through their unique abilities. Additionally, the Spirit Way expansion includes the Merchant villager, one copy per villager deck, as well as the kami-specific components below.
The Awakened expansion will be unlocked upon reaching our first stretch goal. Throughout the campaign, more content will be added to make this a substantial expansion full of diverse content. The Awakened expansion will be an amenity at no additional cost to backers of the game! Further, it will not be available in the initial retail release of Kami-sama. A summary of the contents of the expansion is below!
  For more information on how to play Kami-sama, we encourage you to watch our "How to Play" video below. You may also download and peruse our draft rulebook here.
    Paid Preview
Click to read full review
    This Level Also Available in French & German - See Reward Levels for Details
After funding, backers will unlock The Awakened expansion, which backers will build throughout the campaign! This expansion will not be available in the initial retail release of Kami-sama. Backers will receive The Awakened expansion at no additional cost for participating in our campaign.
                                                 In addition to the traditional funding goals above, Kolossal would love to invite you to participate in our interactive social stretch goals. Simply click the links below to join in the conversation.
Jikan - Ability Naming Poll (BGG)
Eshi - Haiku Contest
  Kami-sama is the second project from Kolossal Games. Though Kolossal is new to the industry, our President - Travis R. Chance - is not. Travis was a founder of Action Phase Games. He is an expert at Kickstarter, funding every game he brought to the platform, including Western Legends, Heroes Wanted, Kodama, and Aeon's End. Our team has spent the last 8 months preparing for the launch of Kami-sama in every way possible.
The game is easy to learn while providing interesting and diverse play each game. Combining familiar mechanisms in a unique presentation, we are confident Kami-sama will be in your game collection for years to come.
The game is beautifully illustrated by our friends at Gong Studios (Netrunner LCG, Charterstone).
We are committed to begin fulfillment of Kami-sama before the game is made available in retail.
Components and materials for the game are near completion upon launch. All files will be uploaded to our manufacturing partner within one week after the end of the campaign. This ensures timely delivery to our backers.
By backing Kami-sama through this campaign, you will receive - at no extra cost - The Awakened expansion. This expansion will include unlocked Stretch Goal content not available in the initial retail release of Kami-sama. We have many exciting and interactive goals planned for those who are backers of Kolossal's second release!
Hundreds of hours have gone into the design and development of this game to ensure a balanced and enjoyable experience. Through extensive global internal and open testing, Kami-sama provides a rich gaming experience like no other game out there.
The utmost thought and care were taken with regard to the theme and source material for the game. As with all of Kolossal's releases, we strive to show diversity and thoughtfully approach inclusion.
Kickstarter is the world's largest funding platform for creative projects. Every month, tens of thousands of people pledge millions of dollars to creative projects in dozens of categories.
A person who supports a project is called a "backer." The process of giving money to this project is called a "pledge."
In return for your pledge, we (the creators of the campaign) are able to offer "rewards," depending on the amount you pledge. For example, if you pledge $50 to help back the project, we'll offer you a copy of the game along with any stretch goals we achieve as soon as it is manufactured.
You can become a backer in just three easy steps:
Step 1: Read through the pledge levels and rewards we're offering in the right sidebar of this page.
Step 2: Click the large, green "BACK THIS PROJECT" button to the right of the trailer video at the top of this page.
Step 3: Enter your pledge amount, and complete the steps for filling in your information. This process takes just a few seconds! That's it! It's really that simple! Thank you for backing!
Once you've backed this project, we encourage you to share this page on social media platforms, such as Facebook and Twitter and share with your friends and family. Also, be sure to like Kolossal Games on Facebook and follow us on Twitter for real-time updates about this project and more!
Please click on your desired reward level to see the shipping cost for your region. Every backer is important to us, regardless of location, but the reality is that shipping is very expensive and is a cost we all need to share. To offset this, while remaining fiscally responsible, we have included a small discount on ALL shipping, but no shipping is free.
The Kami-sama campaign includes Customs-Friendly delivery to the US, Canada, the UK, the EU, Australia, and New Zealand. Customs-Friendly means, if you live in any of these regions and have any additional charges for receiving your package, simply email kickstarter@kolossalgames.com a copy of your customs receipt and we will reimburse you via PayPal.
Add-Ons for this project are included in the reward tiers and will be available after the project within the pledge manager.
If you'd like to add additional copies to your pledge beyond what is available in the reward tiers, you may do so within the pledge manager after the project.

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
While Kami-sama is only the second Kickstarter project from Kolossal Games, our team has years of experience with publishing games. We have an impeccable track record of successfully delivering previous Kickstarter projects to thousands of supporters in a timely fashion--if not sooner. Our commitment to building a strong, supportive community around Kolossal Games will enable us to also deliver this project on time and with the highest quality possible.

That said, there are always complexities and considerations in a project of this scope that may cause delays. There are many steps in the process of manufacturing and fulfilling a game, many of which involve partnerships. Through careful and thorough planning, common mistakes can be avoided. However, possible delays can occur from circumstances beyond our immediate control. If such an issue is encountered, our team will adapt and no corners will be cut to course correct as needed.

Our greatest obstacle is simply the funding capital to manufacture such an ambitious product of the highest quality capable. Your contribution makes this a reality!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: Kami Sama February Third Thursday Update
updates.update_content:
Hello there Kami-sama fans!
We're back with another Third Thursday update for Kami-sama to let you all in on the latest status update. So let's get to it!
Then and Now

Kami-Sama Backers! May we have your attention please?
On our last update we detailed that Backer Fulfillment was nearly complete with nearly all US Backers to receive their copies by the end of the year and Canadian Backers to have their copies begin shipping in early January. Backers in the APAC region and Europe had already received their copies.
Where Are We Now?

Hey Kami-Sama Backers!
So we're rapidly approaching the end of the year and many of you have received your copies. We're so stoked to see people posting on social media about this beautiful game!
The last update we posted on November 30th stated that shipments would begin shipping the first week on December. Turns out our fulfillment centers took a little bit longer to get the shipping started than we had expected and that's what this update is about.  
Shipping Status Update

Hey everyone!
Kami-Sama has cleared US customs, and will be arriving at our fulfillment centers today and begin shipping to backers as early as next week! What's that mean for you? Let's take a look at our Shipping calendar tracker.

Hey Backers! 
We've got dates for port arrivals and therefore an estimated timeline for when you'll start seeing your shipments!  
North America  
Kami-Sama is scheduled to arrive in North American ports on November 18th! Once the crates clear customs they will be shipping direct to our fulfillment centers! This means that after they arrive in port, backers will start seeing their games shipping in 2-4 weeks! Pretty great news!

Production on all copies of Kami-Sama has wrapped up!
A real quick update on what this means for shipping out the games!
Copies for North America and European fulfillment centers are scheduled to go out next week. This means that the next steps will be the French editions arriving in North America and Europe fulfillment centers.

Hello everyone,
Kami-sama has begun shipping to our friends in the East. Backers in Australia, China, Japan, Korea, New Zealand, Taiwan or other countries in the Asia and Oceania areas will begin receiving their packages over the next few weeks.
The orders for our US and EU backers will be loaded up after the Chinese holiday which goes through next week.

Good morning, villagers! Today we have more news on Kami, as well images to share on the production of the game.
Production samples arrived earlier this week. Here are some images of the game. As a publisher, I was blown away by the beauty and execution. This is one of the most striking and lovely games I have had the pleasure to make.

updates.update_userinfo: Proofread rules & new game in the Pandorum’s world.
updates.update_content:
Dear Astronauts,

Thanks for being with us all this time so far! ❤️ With your great feedback, Pandorum becomes only better. And here is one of the main good changes we've made - the proofread rulebooks. You can download them by this link https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/1qHXcSd40gJLT03nqhkmw9o21dFDD-QNz?usp=sharing
Thank you all for supporting us and we're really glad to hear that most of you got their replacement parts already and are happy with the game.  That is really important for us to know that you enjoy Pandorum as we do. 🙃

The second news is that we have an idea to make another game in Pandorum’s world. We have 2 themes that will perfectly fit the gameplay and as you are our best Pandorum fans, we thought that it will be fair to let you decide.

In this game, you explore some planets (cities), construct important buildings and extract resources. The most important thing is to have planets (or cities) under your control – if you have more buildings in the city than other players – you gain all the money paid to the planet (city) repository. The resources extraction and production in the game are limited and look like crisis-management. ✨

In fact, both themes mainly are about the distant future of Pandorum's world.
1) 🌌There are 12 planets, including Pandorum of course, in a constantly changing system of planets. We need to colonize more planets in this system than other players. Each game the position of planets and routes between them will be different.
2) 🚀 Since Pandorum’s colonization, humanity has inhabited many other planets, but after the big cataclysm, they have to return in one of the few lasts planets where humanity can live now - Pandorum. Each game the position of the cities on the Planet will be different, so are routes between them. You know It’s hard to find a way in the blizzard. 🌀

Take a part in game developing and help us to choose the theme for the new game you will see next Essen Spiel. Follow this link and vote:

Hi Astronauts, 
We have some great news. The last components of Pandorum are ready and will be picked up by our logistics provider by the end of this week. As soon as the fulfillment center receives these replacements parts they will start shipping them. We plan to send out all replacements during the next week. In total, we got 39 replacement requests and it's 6.91% from the total number of shipments. Not bad, but could be much better. We've tested the selected packing type several times before shipping. But we missed 1 important thing - the factor of human error. 20 of 39 replacements have been caused by bad handling of local courier services. We're really sorry that some of you received damaged boxes. Stay assured, that all required replacements will be sent during next week. And thank you all for getting in touch with us, you help us to improve our logistic skills and to become better.

campaign.story:
The passion to create a range of dice came a reality for me and my wife back in 2017. As a woodworker who creates gaming accessories it was out of our usual comfort zone but as a regular gamer I knew I wanted to create a quality dice but that was different and unique.
Panther Spirit Dice
From this the 'Spirit of' range of dice was born. The idea of a trapped spirit with in the dice depicted by a 2 colour swirl effect is finished off with the highest dice number being an image of the animal itself.
Turtle Spirit Dice
Each D4 also has a symbol relating to the animal itself represented in place of one of the number 4's.
The dice are made from a high quality poly-resin, they are a nice weight to hold in your hand and have proved to be durable and hardy to wear.
Fae Spirit Dice
My favorites from series 1 would have to be the dragon and hornet spirits I use mine weekly and always think of them as my Patronus helping me battle the monsters within a game or if I am the DM to terrorize the players....but that probably just me! :-)
Octopus Spirit Dice (design to be simplified slightly)
We were so nervous when we put up the Kickstarter for the first range of animals, were people going to like them? Did we have any hope at all of being funded?.....We were blown away by their success and so pleased everybody had the same enthusiasm for the animals that we did. Not only that but great suggestions kept rolling for other animals, two fantastic dice were commissioned with the 'release your spirit' pledge and the ideas rolled on...
Butterfly Spirit Dice
So here we are at Series 2 still just as nervous but looking forward to showing you – a range of animals mainly suggested by this wonderful community and supportive backers :-)
  Every Dice Pledge recieves 1 free critit D6
  Bat Spirit Dice
  The Spirit of the Butterfly and Rabbit
  Fae Spirit Dice
  The Spirit of the Snake and Panther
  Rhino Spirit Dice
  The Spirit of the Pegasus and Turtle
  Scorpion Spirit Dice
  Stag Spirit Dice
  Fox Spirit Dice
      New Stretch Goal!
The Spirit of the Owl as requested and suggested by our wonderful backers.
Owl flying free!
 Now the Owl is unlocked those pledging at the £85 level will receive this dice included in your bundle at no extra charge, and will be available as a option for all other backers to choose :-)
       Check out the First series of 'Spirit of' here
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This will mainly read as a list of things we learnt from the first Kickstarter, we believe we have listened to our previous backers in how the first could be improved, and the previous project certainly set us on a steep learning curve, to say we were unprepared for just how popular they would be is an understatement. 

Time – We delivered on time! Yay! But we want to make sure this happens again, we will be putting in place the same caution and time allowances to cover any delays to try our absolutely best to achieve this again. 

Posting – We thought using the cheapest posting option would be the best to offer the lowest possible rate for our backers, whilst on the whole this was absolutely fine, it does leave questions open when a package is delayed along the way. This time all packages will be tracked and the number given to you so you can check where your dice are :-) We are working with our postal system to negotiate the lowest possible rate for this :-)
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
The keys to everything you love bundled together.
  Howdy! We’re Quentin and Dan from Elderwood Academy, and this Kickstarter we’re inviting you to live our dream together: staying home with tiny dice in tiny wood-carved boxes. Never again need you be the fool at the party without an emergency set of dice contained within a vanity dice holder. Also, free advice: don’t go to parties. Wear PJs and make your friends come to you.
Like their prodigious progenitors, Hex Chest Minis are crafted in a spectacular array of wood options, delicately appointed with engraved art, and finished by hand. They offer a pleasing permutation of personalization, precision, and polish packed into a precious parcel, prepared to portably protect your playthings.
This Kickstarter we’re partnering up with Norse Foundry to make Pebble dice exclusively available along with your Mini Hex Chest. Pebble dice are brand-new miniature zinc-alloy cast masterpieces you could (but absolutely should not) eat like jellybeans and come in a wide range of finishes and themes. If micro precision machined aluminum is more your speed, that's an option, too.
Does it *seriously* have to get this cold? Stay inside, people. Also, it's Purpleheart with Gnomish Copper dice.
  Start off by selecting a wood choice that speaks to you. Choose between the Classic line, which includes Walnut, Cherry, or Mahogany, and the Exotic line which expands your options to include Purpleheart, Lacewood, or Padauk. All Minis are hand-sanded until they're river-stone smooth, tasted for vintage, then brushed with oil for a lasting finish.
Classic wood options
The Classic selection lets you choose between Walnut, Mahogany, and Cherry options. Open and Beehive interiors available with all rewards.
Exotic wood options
The Exotic selection lets you choose between Padauk, Purpleheart, and Lacewood. Open and Beehive interiors available with all rewards.
  Upon an un-warmed rock we espied Padauk with Nightmare Black and Purpleheart with Gnomish Copper. Then we wised up and went home. #Indoors4Life
  All Hex Chest Minis come with engraved art. The Classic line have the Elderwood phoenix etched upon them while the Exotic line opens up your choice of Signature art.
  When pledging for an Exotic Hex Chest Mini, get your choice of Signature art. Classic line all include complementary Elder Phoenix art
  Oh, is it still cold outside? Get wrecked, mother nature. PS Mahogany with Nightmare Black dice.
    The best kind of dice tower
A dice box with dice is a harp playing Crazy Train (hauntingly gratifying). Since we’re partied with Norse Foundry’s minstrels we’re thrilled to be able to offer Pebbles, their new mini metal dice, to accompany you on your quests. Pebbles are forged using zinc-alloy and cast with your choice of six different finishes.
Pebble Dice
Psst. Wanna get low after class?
Miniature Aluminum Dice
If Pebbles aren't getting your rocks off, may we suggest these solid machined aluminum minis? Each set is precision cut to give you the truest rolling in the smallest package possible.
They come in purple, green, black, red, and blue anodized finishes
Miniature Plastic Dice
If you've already got yourself a chunk of randomized metal, you'll also have the option of our Rare Earth Superplastic dice in blue, red, and black. We should note for legal and also common sense reasons that "Rare Earth Superplastic" is remarkably similar to "regular plastic" in that it is regular plastic.
  We had to lean out a window to take this shot. #Courageous. Mahogany and Purpleheart with blue plastic mini polys.
When the campaign closes you’ll be able to further customize your Hex Chest Mini so it can serve you best. Determine your interior design with either Beehive or Open styles. Beehive captures each mini die in its own micro-tomb while Open is more emotionally approachable.
Next, you’ll want to choose whether you want a loop adapter on your Mini Hex Chest (never open your front door diceless ever again) or if you’d rather go with the symmetric all-smooth-sided style. The loop lets you mount your Mini on a keyring, a pocket chain, or a necklace while the all-smooth-sided style slides blindly into a pocket without a hitch.
Open to the left of me, Beehive to the right, here I am, stuck in the middle with you
  This time around we changed things up. Because we hit our stretch goal for the campaign we'll be planting 500 trees! That's enough to cover approximately half a million small wooden projects! Planting will begin near the end of the campaign :D
  Well let’s just say that Minis are 2.1 inches by 2.8 inches whereas other objects can be as large as 11 by 83 inches. Notable! Pebbles are 8.5mm to 13mm (10mm standard scale).
  Quentindo Switch and Danton Abbey are two nerdy boys with big eyes for tiny wood projects. When Q isn’t lounging in the tropics, he spends his time immersed in historical fanfiction and fanfiction reenactments. D likes turtles. You can reach out to and bop either of us any time at info@elderwoodacademy.com, @elderwoodboxes on Twitter, at our Facebook page, or on our waterwheel-powered website.
Norse Foundry is a precision dice and RPG accessory forge founded (...foundried?) on the belief that tabletop gaming can be more fun with the addition of quality gaming gear. Their expert smiths have been fashioning metal dice and coins for adventurers for years. You can digitally stick your hands in their fires here.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We’re Kickstarting Minis and Pebbles because they’re brand new to us and we want the opportunity to create a refined, lasting process around crafting them. We'd like Minis and Pebbles to grow old together and we hope you'll be a part of their origin story. If you join us on our Mini journey you’ll get a first-row seat as together we make micro history.

Hex Chest Minis are our smallest project to date by an order of magnitude. This experience will challenge us to adjust our crafting processes, and offers us the unique opportunity to simultaneously grow our skills while shrinking them.

HOW TO PLAY OVERVIEW : The main goal of Cypress Legacy: The Board Game is to escape the mansion with all of the required Inheritances. There are 16 rooms located around the map. Each room has an entryway that is marked the color green. These entryways may be freely passed through. Some rooms may have locked entryways. These entryways require a keycard to travel through. Cypress Legacy: The Board Game Board
ABOUT THE GAME: Cypress Legacy is an adventurous and competitive board game for two to six players, based on the Cypress Inheritance Saga. Cypress Legacy is a board game series that will continue to evolve, adding more games, based on locations and events within the Cypress Inheritance Saga series. Cypress Legacy was created to be an exciting and engaging board game with intellect, depth, and strategy, for the entire family to enjoy. Produced from the highest-quality materials and packaging and evolving through several iterations over the past few years, we believe we have achieved a game that has not only exceeded our company’s goals, but is also something that will appeal to gamers of all ages and experiences. Our testers have shown a tremendous positive response, and we think you will enjoy the game as well! The story you are playing within begins with Lorna Ritten just learning of Alfred Cypress, the grandfather she has never known. Lorna has always wanted to find out more about her biological family, which has always been a mystery. Her grandfather’s attorney, Phillip Brandt, tells Lorna of an inheritance, which includes one of her grandfather’s many mansions and its contents. Her desire to know more marks the beginning of a very unique and potentially dangerous situation. Lorna has no idea just how important this actually is to her and will be to others. As Lorna is studying some of the inheritance documents before visiting the mansion, she realizes there are objects that hold key information hidden throughout the mansion. These include maps and other unique items concerning Alfred’s work, as well as more about Lorna’s biological family. And even though she realizes she is being watched and is possibly even in danger, she still wants to move forward. With this in mind as you begin the game, imagine Lorna has called on you as her true and trusted friend to help secure these items from the Cypress Mansion and then get out as quickly as possible. You will encounter others who are trying to get this valuable information as well, so you need to be careful and trust no one. The mansion itself also has many surprises to make your mission even more exciting—and dangerous. You will need to use the resources available and pay attention to everything. Regardless of what you face, you must continue to acquire what is needed to help Lorna in her quest to learn the truth, gain the assets, and then get out safely. About Cypress Inheritance Saga:

campaign.story:
Ride a rocket to extraordinary destinations across our galaxy. During your travels, you’ll gather exotic crystals that further our understanding of what’s out there. Use crystals to earn exploration badges by turning them in at the mysterious Outpost 13 to prove yourself as the galaxy’s next great explorer in Space Park!
What’s in the Box
1 Modular Board featuring 7 Destinations • 3 Rocket Minis • 12 Purple Crystals • 12 Teal Crystals • 24 Small Pink Crystals • 27 Square Badge Cards (70 x 70mm) • 1 Scout Explorer Bot Standee • 1 Scouter • 12 Fast Travel Tokens • 15 Explore Point Tokens • 1 First Player Marker • Rulebook
Game Overview
View the Rules Here
20–30 Minutes • 1-4 Players — Space Park can be enjoyed with 5–6 players, but plays optimally with 1–4.
What's the theme? – Think national parks in space. Explore exotic destinations and earn badges to prove yourself as the galaxy's best explorer.
What makes it unique? – A destination can be visited if it has a rocket on top. Once a destination is visited the rocket moves clockwise around the board to the next open destination—skipping over any with rockets already on top. Choosing where to go might help you, but it also opens up places for your opponents. 
How do you win? – Collect the most Explorer Points (XP) by the end of the game by earning space badges.
Stretch Goals
Game Setup
      Rockets begin at the starting destinations and components are placed by their corresponding actions. Each player receives one badge to begin. Three badges are placed face up by Starlight Station and the rest form the the badge deck on top of it.
Give the First Traveler marker to whoever most recently looked at the stars. Play begins with the First Traveler and proceeds clockwise.
Visiting Destinations
On your turn, you’ll choose which which destination to visit:
Choose a destination with a rocket on it
Perform the action of the chosen destination
Move the rocket to the next destination in the clockwise rotation, skipping over any destinations that already have rockets on them.
Destination Actions
Your Trusty, Explorer Bot—Scout
Scout's design will be changing slightly. Take a look at the new one in our latest update.
Scout moves to new destinations when players visit Astral Arcade. Whenever any player visits a destination with Scout on it, the player who currently has the Scouter may choose to gain either a Pink Crystal or a Fast Travel pass from the supply. 
Fast Travel
Before visiting a destination, Fast Travel tokens can be spent on your turn to move one Rocket to the next available destination—multiple tokens may be spent in a single turn before choosing a destination. 
Badge Perks
After you earn a badge, you'll gain its Explorer Points (XP) in the top right and its perk on the bottom. Some are ongoing whereas others trigger immediately. Getting great badge combos can be a sure way to victory.
Game End
When a player has reached 20 or more Explorer Points, finish the current round of play so each player gets an equal number of turns—the last player should be the person to the right of the First Traveler. The player with the most Explore Points at the end is the winner of Space Park!
Solo Mode: Playing Against Scout
In solo mode, a player is racing to score 20 XP against Scout who is running through the Badge deck to move himself and the rockets around the board. Read more about it in the Rules. 
Watch the Solo Mode Play-through Here:
    The Team behind Space Park
Artwork by Orlin Culture Shop • Game Design by Henry Audubon • Game Development by Keymaster Games • Sculpts by Heriberto Valle • Video by MDS

updates.update_userinfo: New Adventurers Await in Keymaster's Latest Kickstarter
updates.update_content:
Hello Explorers!
How are you enjoying the galaxy? The knowledge gained from all those exotic Sun and Moon crystals you keep collecting is paving the way for the future.
On your next pitstop at Starlight Station, you’ll find our latest project is ENDING SOON on Kickstarter. Join the heist in Caper: Europe, a delightfully devious drafting game for two players. In Caper: Europe, you’ll work against your opponent to recruit thieves, send them to strategic locations, and equip them with the best gear. Succeed and you’ll be stealing from some of the most famous places across Europe.

Explorers,
Happy New Year!

Hello Explorers
Wednesday is the retail release of Space Park! We can't to see this game on retailers’ shelves and grow our adventuring community. While this might be exciting for some, we know that this news can be frustrating for those who have yet to receive the game. We share those frustrations and feel like we have learned a number of things about fulfillment throughout this Kickstarter that will help us on the next one. It was never our intention to have this happen and our fulfillment company had the games long before distributors did, but it doesn't change where we stand today. We hope we can take a step to make it right for those of you who aren't happy.

Hello Explorers,
A huge thank you for your patience as we work to get games into your hand. We had hoped to get this update out early last week, but were unable to acquire specific timelines from our fulfillment partners as they had not locked in fulfillment windows for Space Park. This is something we are reviewing for future campaigns as we currently do not have leverage to influence partner timelines.

updates.update_userinfo: Fulfillment Estimates and Cool 3D printed Component Trays
updates.update_content:
Greetings explorers!
Thank you to all shout outs in our comments from those who have received their games. We love hearing from you and seeing all your unboxing and gameplay pictures on social media! Several of you have asked about Posters. The printer has the order and the posters will be shipped directly from them very soon. Note, they are being shipped separately, so this has no impact on game shipment.

Docking at Starlight Station
Explorers! Space Park is nearing the final end of its journey. The games have landed in Florida and we are getting updates from Quartermaster, our fulfillment company, to hear when they clear customs. Shortly afterwards it'll make a trip to their fulfillment center, and then everyone will start receiving tracking numbers!
In Other News

It's on a boat!
That's right, Space Park is currently making its way across the Pacific! Hopefully a Kaiju doesn't have a taste for space crystals. Speaking of crystals, there was a issue at the end of manufacturing where crystal sizes/colors were swapped. While our KS page had August as our expected delivery date, our internal goal was to ship to backers by GenCon (early August). Unfortunately, this hiccup was big enough that we will miss that date. That said, there is still a scenario where orders start shipping by August 31. Right now, our boat is scheduled to pull into Jacksonville, FL the week of the 20th. Once through customs, it's a quick 135 mile drive down to Quartermaster's fulfillment center in Orlando.

Explorers, 
We’re excited to report Space Park is reaching its final stages of manufacturing! Soon it’ll go into hyper-sleep to begin its trek across the vast Pacific. With the approach of this voyage there are a few things we want to update you on.
Origins Last Week

campaign.story:
10 years ago... A mysterious burst in the sky gave ordinary men and women extraordinary powers. They're called EPICS.
But, every Epic turned out to be EVIL. Today, in the city once known as Chicago (now Newcago), an all-powerful Epic named STEELHEART reigns supreme!
Nobody fights back... nobody but THE RECKONERS! This is where you come in. You are a member of the Reckoners, a skilled group of normal humans who assassinate Epics.
Play as 1 of 6 Reckoners from the books
Your mission is simple, but not easy. Take down Steelheart and his Epics and SAVE THE CITY. 
Promos may be sold separately after Kickstarter. Deluxe KS promos included only for DELUXE and EPIC pledge levels.  
  DELUXE and EPIC pledge levels will not be sold through retail, unless a retailer purchased via this Kickstarter. Limited copies may be sold at conventions or via our online shop while supplies last.
For the EPIC pledge level, the Player Miniatures and the PVC Steelheart Miniature will be pre-painted by PandaGM's studio - the same place that brought you the beautifully painted Mechs Vs. Minions miniatures.
The Reckoners is a simultaneous, CO-OPERATIVE game for 1-6 players that plays in 75 minutes. During the game, you control one of the members of The Reckoners team. YOU WIN BY DEFEATING STEELHEART. But before you can defeat him, you must first discover his weakness. 
Steelheart Tray, Action Tracks, and Weakness Board. Note: The Power Tracks can be adjusted for difficulty.
Seems simple, right? Did I mention that Steelheart and all his Epics have SUPERPOWERS? 
Each round, all of the Epics are going to activate, performing an array of actions and then powering up to be even more devastating next round. If the Epics manage to destroy Newcago by reducing the population to 0, then ALL RECKONERS LOSE.
Activate Epic Actions Animation. Perform Epic actions and then move the bracket up by 1 + number of Enforcement
So, what are you going to do about it? At the start of the Reckoners turn, all players will SIMULTANEOUSLY ROLL THEIR DICE, selecting which results to keep until the next step.
Roll Dice Step Animation
Each Reckoner starts with 6 dice (3 white and 3 matching their color). Each colored dice has a side with a double symbol on it, which naturally makes each Reckoner better at certain aspects of the game. Once all players have finished rolling, it's time to USE DICE TO TAKE ACTIONS.
Use Dice Step Animation
Once again, players simultaneously perform actions, and when all Reckoners have finished using their dice, then their turn is over. 
Example Research and Attack Epic Actions
Researching and Attacking Epics will help you earn valuable rewards, including clues about Steelheart's weakness. But, there will always be more Epics than you, so you have to choose your battles wisely.
25+ Unique Epic Cards (tarot sized 80x120mm)
You'll also want to acquire EQUIPMENT CARDS, which enable you to perform more actions each turn, manipulate your dice, and build a powerful engine to takedown Steelheart. Don't forget about PLAN TOKENS either! These can help you when the dice don't go your way and you need to get out of a jam.
Purchase Equipment Cards to build your action engine and become powerful enough to takedown Steelheart.
Your dice can also be used to contain epics, attack Enforcement, move around the game board, remove barricades, and activate special equipment powers. You can read more on full gameplay by downloading our rulebook. 
Rodney Smith from WatchItPlayed has agreed to teach the game on his YouTube channel, so keep an eye out for it later this year.
WHAT ABOUT REPLAYABILITY?
The Reckoners was designed to be different every single time it's played. Yes, you will always face Steelheart in the base game, but his presence and abilities will vary greatly from game to game because they are derived from the Epics on the game board. Which Epics are out, the order they come out in, and how powerful they become will all affect Steelheart differently each game. Compound this with the variations of Equipment Cards, different Reckoners in the game, and combinations of die rolls, and now you've created a truly unique experience.
We have nearly 100 unique illustrations in the game. A PDF of the Character and Epic artwork will be included with every pledge. Check out some sample cards below for a closer look at the incredible game art by Miguel Coimbra and Ian O'Toole. 
File Size: 38MB
Lastly, it's hard to convey what the final dice actually look like in 3D renderings because they are made of transparent resin material. You can get a better idea from the photos below during our sampling process or view the BoardGameCorner video in the Reviews section.
19mm transparent resin dice with custom heat transfer symbols
  The Reckoners joins Zombicide Black Plague, Cry Havoc, and a few other select titles by earning the CORNER CERTIFIED AWARD from the BoardGameCorner, a member of the Dice Tower Network. 
This is an award for excellence for games, components, or accessories of exceptional quality and fun. Check out their Kickstarter Preview Video below.
 Boardgame Corner LIVE Final Thoughts
 If you would like to see the entire live stream, check out the full game playthrough here. Note: All game components are in prototype form and subject to change (and improvement).
Additionally, we've worked closely with Brandon's team and Dragonsteel Entertainment to ensure that the game is representative of the world mythos and enjoyable for fans of the series and gamers alike.
  We also had the chance to sit down and play the game with a few reviewers at conventions last year. Here's what a few of them had to say:
    Estimated Shipping Costs
Shipping costs are not included in your pledge and will be charged when shipping for The Reckoners begins.
Nauvoo Games will be shipping via fulfillment partners in regions around the world as we've done for several campaigns in the past. This enables us to keep costs as low as possible. However, the reality is that shipping is very expensive, especially for a big box game with lots of components like The Reckoners.
Charging a flat-rate for shipping can be unfair for the backer or the creator, and we want to avoid any surprises. For this reason, we will be using a Pledge Manager for this project, which allows us to more accurately charge shipping costs after the Kickstarter campaign ends. We will only charge shipping based on the weight and destination of your order.
The above table lists estimated shipping costs by destination for one copy of The Reckoners board game after our subsidy. We understand the estimates are broad, so this may do little to help you budget. Therefore, once your shipping rate is determined in the Pledge Manager, we will give you the option to cancel your pledge for a full refund, minus any Kickstarter fees we incur, if you are unhappy with the amount.
If you would like to order more than one copy, then you may do so after the campaign ends. The Pledge Manager will automatically calculate shipping costs for your pledge and any optional add-ons.
We welcome retail partners to support The Reckoners, and we offer standard retailer discounts. To join us:
Pledge for 1 copy of the BASE game. The amount will be subtracted from your total order later when games are ready to ship.
Enter your information and desired quantities into this form. If you need to edit your responses, send us a message.
And finally, a special thanks to Brandon Sanderson and all of the folks at Dragonsteel Entertainment and JABberwocky for making this project possible!

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We have successfully finished 3 Kickstarter projects and delivered each of them ahead of schedule. We've been around the block enough to know that there are often unexpected obstacles, and we promise to meet these challenges with strong work ethic and transparent communication.

We are confident in the design of the game, as proven by almost 18 months of playtesting and reviewer feedback. However, the Reckoners is our biggest game yet with very challenging production requirements. We've been working with our manufacturer for multiple months already to generate samples and finalize all materials to ensure it has excellent quality production. But added stretch goals might take more time to complete.

Please note that the final product might change slightly during the mass manufacturing process or get delayed. We are fully devoted to creating an amazing experience with The Reckoners, and we strive to give our backers excellent customer support throughout the process. We hope you will support our project with confidence and help make The Reckoners the best game possible.

REFUND POLICY

You are entitled to a full refund of your pledge within 14 days of the campaign's end, no questions asked. After that, we will refund 80% of your pledge up until 12 weeks before shipping (when the survey goes out). Once we've begun the survey process, NO refunds are possible. If for some reason a component is unable to be delivered, then we will refund that completely, including fees.

Refunds within the 14 day window are reversed via Stripe directly to your credit card. After 14 days, we will provide refunds via PayPal up until the cut-off time. Any refunds processed will be in USD. 

TERMS & CONDITIONS

By backing this project, you agree to log into your Kickstarter account and submit your project survey results, thereby providing us with your information (i.e. shipping address) to fulfill your pledge rewards, within 12 weeks of our survey notification. 

If you do not provide your information as indicated above within 12 weeks of our notification, you also agree that we have fulfilled our obligations to you in full for payment or donations received. 

We may, at our discretion, offer a refund or ship your pledge (at additional cost for international backers) if you complete your project survey after the 12-week window has elapsed.

If you do not accept these terms, please do not pledge on this project and instead wait for the general release.

campaign.story:
Vagabonds of Dyfed is designed to emulate the skullduggery and thrill of old-school rpgs with updated mechanics. It takes the hardcore ideals of emergent storytelling and fictional positioning, and slots into an atomically small Powered by the Apocalypse mechanic.
by Per Folmer
Our design goals were simple: make a game that's mechanically compatible with OSR retroclones (and their mountains of content) while leveraging the compact but non-binary PbtA system.
A single PbtA "move" core: 2d6 + mod, tiered results
Player-generated character traits instead of predefined playbooks or attributes
High character lethality
Strong GM authority
Vagabonds picks the pockets of greater games: World of Dungeons, Lamentations of the Flame Princess, Barbarians of Lemuria, Blades in the Dark, City of Mist, the Black Hack and the White Hack, and of course the grandaddy of them all: Moldvay's venerable Basic.
by Dean Spencer
The game itself is as lean as we can make it, clocking in at around 120 pages jam-packed with rules and examples. It's written and laid out specifically to be easy to comprehend with a single skim or quickly referenced at the table. We've even gone so far as to make distinct layouts for print and PDF to make each format as useful as possible.
People've been rehashing dungeon-crawlers for over forty years; rather than try to reinvent the wheel, Vagabonds takes advantage of all that existing material.
by Dean Spencer
There are literally thousands of adventures and modules that we want to tap into, but there's room for mechanical improvement in both OSR and PbtA. Vagabonds unifies the feel of B/X with the benefit of flexible characters and gradient outcomes.
Basically, Vagabonds is a collection of components from games that fit together well and align with our preference for old-school dungeon crawlers. No fuss, no real innovation, just a game that makes OSR adventures even more enjoyable.
If you liked World of Dungeons but wanted more heft, or you thought Dungeon World was too close to new-school story games, or you wished there was some more variability in characters and outcomes from LotFP, then Vagabonds is designed for you.
Player-defined traits
A list of PbtA-move-inspired techniques
Linear, shallow power curve
No classes, playbooks, or attributes
Vagabonds' largest departure from OSR and PbtA games is in the way characters are constructed. Each character is a collection of trait tags -- short player-written phrases that describe aspects of their character. This is similar to the recently released City of Mist or to Barbarians of Lemuria's use of careers as skills.
by Per Folmer
There are five starting traits you define for your character:
Approach: the way you solve conflict
Gimmick: a memorable or noteworthy quirk
Background: what you used to do or be
Foreground: your current skillset or field
Weakness: something you struggle to do well with
These traits not only inform your roleplaying decisions but actually provide a mechanical bonus any time they're relevant. Each relevant trait tag applies a +1 (or a -1 if detrimental) to your roll, with a max of +3 or -3. 
by Dean Spencer
You create more trait tags as you level up; these new traits don't have to fall into one of the five starting categories. Characters develop in organic and convoluted ways.
But characters are more than just the sum of a handful of traits, as they'll have specific abilities granted to them through their history or expertise:
Lineages: a character's bloodline or cultural background (such as elf or beastkin). Lineages provide passive benefits as well as some unique abilities.
Techniques: a catch-all for maneuvers, feats, spells, and PbtA-style moves -- dozens of techniques offer a wide variety of choices to help flesh out a character.
Single page layout by Evan Rowland
  Sum 2d6 + modifier
The results determine a gradient between failure and complete success
The players do all of the rolling (usually)
Those familiar with PbtA games will see a familiar setup and split here. Every roll is pretty much the same: you roll two six-sided dice and add your character's aptitude (the sum of all relevant tags, be they trait tags, injury tags, or item tags). The total result of the roll determines the outcome:
A result of 6 or less is a failure and triggers some kind of calamity or consequence.
A result of 7 to 9 is a partial success, or one with some wrinkle or complication.
A result of 10 to 12 is just a flat success; you do the thing.
Anything 13 or higher is a success with an added benefit; it's a critical success or some knock-on win that occurred because of how capable you are.
by Dean Spencer
We've followed World of Dungeons' suit in eschewing the complexity of many different "basic moves" or "core moves." Instead, everything boils down to the outcomes above, though certain techniques or niche actions might have specific outcomes determined by the rules rather than GM fiat. 
Vagabonds of Dyfed comes with 30 must-have enemies, complete with statblocks designed for expediency and at-the-table efficiency.
Statblock layout by Evan Rowland
We've included tools for building your own monsters (utilizing special abilities and tags) and for converting OSR classics. Few calculations are necessary, and most monsters from other B/X-compatible games can be run as-is. Because Vagabonds does away with much of the rigorous uniformity of PbtA games, it doesn't crumble when you introduce mechanics from, say, DCC or LotFP.
by Dean Spencer
  Vagabonds incorporates a multitude of other plug-and-play subsystems to suit your group's playstyle:
Plan and Prep rolls: speed up play if you don't have time to plan every detail and stow every torch
Tool kits: packets of role-specific items
Travel turns: track and trigger random dungeon or wilderness encounters over distances
Hirelings: allies, mercenaries, even warhounds
by Dean Spencer
One-roll attack and damage: quicken your damage calculations using the core 2d6 roll, both for PCs and enemy attacks
Easy but interesting equipment rules: equipment functions like a combination of tags and techniques, sometimes granting permissions or bonuses, othertimes entire abilities or spells
Downtime scenes: cribbed and simplified from Blades in the Dark, but works surprisingly well in an OSR context
Decays and hazards: weather, poison, spell-mutations, and looming threats
Premade archetypes: want to get started in five minutes? Grab an archetype and start slayin'
Written and designed by Ben Dutter
Art by Per Folmer and Dean Spencer
Layout by Evan Rowland
Editing by Joshua Yearsley
The book's completely written and 100% edited. Layout is well underway (as you've seen on this page). Art is nearly final. The interior is in a modern black and white aesthetic with OSR-style ink art, laid out in a dual-column 8.5" x 8.5" square format.
You can read the complete, edited (but not laid out) draft here.
Print spread layout by Evan Rowland
The PDF has been laid out separately from the print book to allow for ease of use on a phone or tablet. A comprehensive table of contents with internal linking makes it easy to reference.
We're sticking with POD this time around, as our foray into offset printing in recent Kickstarters has met with dissatisfactory delays and shipping issues. This project is clean and simple -- you'll get a link to DriveThru RPG and can download the PDF for free or pay the hardcosts for a print book.
by Dean Spencer
 Wait, how do I get my book?
When you pledge to this Kickstarter at the $10 level, you get the PDF copy and "at-cost" print-on-demand from DriveThru RPG. At-cost POD basically means that you, the backer, have to pay another company (DriveThru, in this case) a few more bucks in order for them to print and ship a black and white book to you. 
So you pay me, through Kickstarter, $10 and I send you the PDF and a link. You click the link, pay DriveThru some more money (est. $5 + shipping) and get your PDF and print copy. The reason is it's "at-cost" is basically I make no additional money off the sale of those print copies, all of my revenue comes from the $10 pledge. DTRPG takes what's left (they have to cover the costs of printing).
If you don't want the POD, no problem, you never have to use it. Give it to a friend or just ignore it for eternity. 
 Stretch Goals
Every $2,000 beyond the initial funding goal unlocks a new stretch goal (up to $10,000). Each goal is a unique piece of content that will be for sale after the Kickstarter ends (but you clever Kickstarter backers get for your $10 pledge).
Stjernheim: Siege at Deepknell Barrow. Unlocked at $6,000 is a ~40 page adventure supplement that focuses on three unique factions battling over the control of an ancient Dwarven Ruin. Inspired by nordic fantasy (think D&Disms + Skyrim) and includes new lineages, techniques, and monsters. 
More to be revealed!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This is our eighth Kickstarter. Our very first failed to fund, and our second-to-most recent (Clash of Steel, a card game) is still in the final stages of fulfillment. Clash of Steel is the only project that was delivered late, and it was due to the very unfortunate and untimely death of Stewart Wieck, who was handling distribution and logistics. 

The fact that we still managed to print 10,000 decks and get them largely shipped to all of our backers -- admittedly late -- is a testament to the team's dedication to completing our projects.

This game and project is FAR simpler; art's pretty much done, writing is 100% done, layout is nearly done. Even if one of the principal contributors met with some calamity I'm confident that we'd be able to deliver without much issue and on time. Furthermore, this game is essentially a digital PDF and link to an at-cost print on demand code, so there's far fewer logistics than in some of our more recent (and ambitious) projects.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter
